proposal:
Title: Proposal to Add gmBTC on Arbitrum Aave v3 Liquidity Pool

   Author: 0xlide - SaucyBlock, dated 2024-02-05

   Summary: The proposal aims to integrate gmBTC (a BTC-USD's Liquidity Token on the GMX V2) as a collateral asset in the Aave V3 Arbitrum Pool. This integration could potentially create new demand for borrowable assets on Aave V3. The parameters for gmETH and gmBTC are provided, with key features such as Collateral Enabled, Supply Cap, LTV, and Liquidation Bonus specified. The proposal progresses through ARFC stages if consensus is reached and risk service providers approve the risk parameters. The project details, GitHub, Docs, Audit, Twitter, Discord links are provided for reference.

The "DeFi" Committee Formation Proposal is open for voting in Special Voting Cycle #5. Up to 4 committees will be approved for Season 2, with delegates encouraged to vote for their top 1-2 per category for diversity. For more details, visit the Governance Committees introduction at gov.optimism.io.
Balancer may develop tools to aid institutions in managing assets, addressing regulatory concerns associated with public pool usage.

Orbiter Finance is a decentralized data communication service built on ZK-tech and Ethereum, enabling instant, secure, and efficient cross-rollup transactions of Ethereum-native assets. It supports multiple networks such as Ethereum, zkSync Era, Arbitrum, Optimism, Polygon, and more. With over 3.8 million users, 23 million transactions, and a daily transaction volume of over $22 million, Orbiter Finance aims to enhance user experiences and unlock new functionalities through its OpenAPI documentation. The team looks forward to collaborations on this exciting journey.

Blog post discusses the impact of artificial intelligence on various industries, citing examples and potential benefits such as increased efficiency and productivity. It also warns about potential risks like job displacement and privacy concerns, suggesting the need for regulation and ethical guidelines.

Alphaday, a platform developed by Aave Grantees, offers a comprehensive solution for managing cryptocurrencies across devices. It features portfolio tracking, real-time market updates, personalized news and insights, and a customizable user interface. The platform consolidates various crypto sources into a single dashboard, making it easier to stay informed in the rapidly changing crypto space. Alphaday is free and highly customizable, allowing users to tailor their dashboard layout. Access Alphaday at [website link removed].

Fringe Finance has launched its V2 platform, introducing features that benefit $BAL token holders. The new version offers leveraged trading (Margin Trade and Amplify), a dynamic interest rate model for higher yields, the ability to repay loans using collateral, expanded asset availability across multiple chains, and an incentive program to reward lenders. The incentive program is structured around TVL milestones, with rewards issued in FRIN tokens based on a lender's proportion of total interest earned. This program aims to stimulate adoption by offering triple rewards: from $BAL token growth, lender interest, and rewards from the program itself.

The Wolfible Token distribution consists of 2 Million tokens, with 50% reserved for the Initial Farm Offering (IFO) on PancakeSwap, locked for 48 months and 30% for DAO. 25% is allocated for liquidity, farms, reward pools, and 10% each for marketing, team, and charity, with vesting periods. Wolfible is an NFT platform that aims to facilitate easy and affordable creation of NFTs, with a focus on community ownership through the native governance token $WOFT. For more information, visit the project's official channels: website, documentation, Twitter, and Telegram. To join the IFO on PancakeSwap, follow the provided guide.

The text discusses a proposal for Cake (CAKE) to expand its presence across multiple blockchain networks, such as Polygon, Ethereum, and Avalanche. This expansion involves making the Pancakeswap protocol accessible on these chains and offering CAKE tokens for purchase. The BNB Chain will continue to be the primary network with ongoing management and development, while cross-chain Pancakeswap aims to generate additional trading fees and boost CAKE token awareness. Additionally, the text suggests initial seed liquidity pools for CAKE on each new chain it enters.

The community is requesting support to list sAVAX as a collateral asset, which is the Liquid Staking token from BENQI protocol on the Avalanche network. sAVAX allows users to unlock liquidity while participating in securing the Avalanche network and generates revenue through network validation rewards. It has over 3M sAVAX in circulation with deep liquidity in Automated Market Makers (AMMs) for a healthy lending market ecosystem.

BENQI is a Liquid Staking solution that allows users to stake AVAX to receive sAVAX, which then delegates the staked AVAX to nodes for network validation, generating approximately 7.20% APR. sAVAX can be redeemed back for AVAX after a 15 days cooldown period in a 2 days redemption window.

Using sAVAX as a collateralized asset on AAVE would increase interest earned on supplying and reduce the cost of borrowing due to its yield-bearing nature. It is integrated with various protocols like Anchor, Kyber, Trader Joe, Ribbon, and Platypus.

BENQI was launched in 2021 as DeFi activity on the Avalanche network grew, and it supports another layer of DeFi primitive, Liquid Staking. Over $200M is being staked via BENQI, with over $100M of liquidity across AMMs.

The asset currently used includes over 3M AVAX (~ $200M) being staked via BENQI and over $100M of liquidity across AMMs. sAVAX is integrated by protocols such as Anchor, Platypus, Ribbon Finance, More Money, Trade Joe, Kyber, and Pangolin.

The market cap of sAVAX is $168M, with a 24hr volume of $2.2M. It is listed on exchanges like Trader Joe, Kyber, and Pangolin. The number of transactions is 59,902, and the number of holders is 4,070.

The social channels data shows that BENQI has a Twitter following of 62.9k and a Telegram following of 13.35k. The contracts were deployed on January 27, 2022, with no emission schedule. sAVAX cannot be minted without staking AVAX in the contract, and a multisig is currently the owner of the minting contract, which belongs to BENQI's core team.

The architecture of sAVAX uses a pool share system, and the withdrawal and delegation process is protected in a hardened memory-only runtime environment with no remote access and extremely restricted physical access. The architecture is currently transitioning into a distributed, multi-party computational system to ensure security and consensus for transaction execution.

ACREinvest is a blockchain venture focused on Web3 infrastructure, virtual network services, and social incentives for DAOs. The delegate address from Dec 2021 to Nov 2022 is 0x4d3aC33AB1dd7B0F352b8E590Fe8b62c4C39eAd5, and the delegate address for Nov 2022 - Nov 2023 is 0x06e8dedf9e1adb1eba32f36ea9223770ba378b77. The venture is led by Kianga Daverington, the founder of Acre of America, an impact investment management firm.

ACREinvest's mission is to revolutionize capital markets and aims to apply two decades of legal experience in derivatives and commodities markets to DeFi, specifically MakerDAO. The venture has launched ACRE DAOs, a Web3 portal for a decentralized impact investment club and its related ERC-20 token: ACRE Impact.

ACREinvest operates with core values of Creativity, Common Sense, and Compliance. Kianga pledges to keep the community updated on any potential conflicts of interest and agrees to abide by the Delegate Code of Conduct. However, her role is not in her professional capacity as an attorney, and none of her comments or communications should be considered legal advice.

By delegating MKR to ACREinvest, individuals acknowledge that neither Kianga Daverington nor ACREinvest are liable for any damages or losses related to the delegation of MKR. It is the responsibility of the individual to understand the risks and costs associated with delegating their MKR.

The Sushi team has secured 16 million dollars (approx.) in incentives from Polygon and xDai foundations to boost liquidity. Two proposed solutions for matching these funds are using a portion of the existing treasury (over 200 million dollars) or lowering incentives for certain pairs at the core team's discretion. The Sushi team also secured 1 million dollars in incentives from xDai, aiming to foster more liquidity and users across various networks. This move is aimed at positioning Sushi as a leading DEX on multiple locations, with all revenues benefiting xSushi holders. For now, the team suggests leveraging the treasury due to technical complexity in bridging emissions.

The project aims to develop an avatar generator tool with customizable 3D traits, optimized for ApeCoin's ecosystem. The development will include:

1. Design of accessories, 3D sculpture, optimization, texturing, rigging, and quality assurance for the 3D segment.
2. Minting campaigns of the traits using smart contracts in ApeChain, ensuring security and quality assurance for the blockchain development.
3. Adapting the current tech to a new ApeCoin UI, fitting the avatar generator system to the traits, and maintaining the website with UI/UX Design, Frontend Development, Backend Development, and Quality Assurance.

The project will be developed by separate in-house teams over 12 months, starting from August 2024 to December 2025. The milestones include:

- UI/UX designed and published.
- Base avatar designed, developed, and published.
- Traits/Accessories designed, developed, and published.
- Launch of the tool.
- Publication of guides on how to use the avatars.

The key performance indicators (KPIs) will be:

- Number of avatars created.
- Unique wallets that have created an avatar.
- Content impressions with the avatars being used.

The total cost of the project is estimated to be $370,000, including salaries, licenses for tools, hardware and server costs, and other associated expenses. The breakdown of the costs is as follows:

- Blockchain Dev: $60,000
- 3D Programming: $60,000
- Graphic Design: $10,000
- Frontend Development: $40,000
- Backend Development: $80,000
- 3D modelling & texturing (same artists): $90,000
- Rigging: $30,000

The APE Foundation will be required to grant access to a subdomain for hosting the project or offer their 3D Avatar Platform as a host for one year. The community will also be involved in suggesting and requesting traits they'd like to see.

Reporting expectations include bi-weekly updates on progress and a public Notion page visible to anyone with the progress on minor and major milestones. Updates will be released throughout the year, with new accessories being added each month.

The text discusses a rebranding proposal for SushiSwap, a popular cryptocurrency project, following recent events involving ChefNomi and the devfund. The community is encouraged to submit new logo designs in a contest called "The SushiSwap Dragonroll Logo Contest." The winning design will become the new SushiSwap logo, with the winner being titled "Master of Dragonrolls" and receiving 500 $SUSHI. Second and third place winners will also receive prizes in $SUSHI. The community will vote on the top 5 submissions to determine the final design.

The proposal aims to whitelist the COW/ETH pool gauge for veBAL voting, strengthening ties between COW and BAL communities. The COW Protocol allows users to swap assets at optimal exchange rates by delegating trade execution to solvers, who compete to offer the best possible rate. This batching of trades reduces gas costs, AMM fees, and execution risk, resulting in better prices than existing DEX aggregators. The COW Protocol is governed by its token holders and has undergone audits for its settlement contract and COW token. However, it still relies on a centralized server for orderbook and solver competition, with plans to decentralize this aspect in the future. COW was launched with incentives for providing liquidity on Balancer pools, and is now considering using veBAL voting to boost BAL rewards for COW pools.
Discussion needed on potential funding for reducing risks for participants in active Credit Unions, with numerous feasible opportunities identified by a corporate attorney.

This text is about Uniswap, an on-chain trading protocol that allows for free creation, trading, and provision of liquidity via Automated Market Maker (AMM). Users can access it through the Uniswap website, Discord, Twitter, or GitHub. The token associated with Uniswap is UNI, and more information can be found on Coingecko. The Ethereum address for Uniswap is 0x1f9840a85d5af5bf1d1762f925bdaddc4201f984.

The text discusses a proposal for ApeID, a web2/web3 login system similar to AppleID, Facebook Login, and Google Login. This system aims to onboard users to any site, whether they hold ApeCoin or not, and allow ApeCoin holders to connect their wallets. The benefits include mass adoption and exposure for ApeCoin, acting as a potential loyalty card for web3, and potentially making ApeCoin the coin of choice for other web3 businesses. The system will be built by an experienced team and is expected to take 4-5 months for V1. Updates will be provided quarterly, and costs will include software development, marketing, advertising, and tech support. This proposal serves as a foundation for a larger vision for ApeID.

A new hBTC/wBTC pool is being added to Curve for increased BTC liquidity on Ethereum. The pool, optimized for gas efficiency and without lending, attracts more liquidity, enabling easier swaps between the two assets. This should boost liquidity for all Bitcoin forms on Curve.

Title: Polygon v2 Borrow Rate Adjustments Proposal
   Authors: @karpatkey_TokenLogic & @ChaosLabs
   Date: 2024-04-04

This publication proposes gradually increasing borrow rates on Polygon v2 to encourage users to migrate to Aave v3. The Reserve Factor (RF) on Polygon v2 has increased over the past 8 months, reducing capital efficiency and deposit yield.

The proposal suggests incrementing the Slope1 parameter for non-frozen assets by 75bps every two weeks to encourage migration from v2 to v3. The Uoptimal will also be adjusted periodically to discourage new debt positions.

For frozen assets, the Uoptimal will be reduced to 10%, Slope1 to 50%, and Slope2 to 500% (except for BAL with a Uoptimal of 20% due to current utilization).

The changes will not trigger liquidation of users' funds and will gradually increase the cost for those remaining on v2. A migration tool is available to aid transition from v2 to v3.

Assets affected: DAI, MATIC, wBTC, wETH, USDC, USDT, BAL, CRV, DPI, GHST, LINK, and SUSHI.

The proposal will be escalated to the Snapshot stage if community consensus is reached. If approved, a subsequent proposal will be submitted every two weeks.

10 USDT will be converted to 9 VAI considering the exchange rate of min(1, 0.9). If a user wants to send 10 USDT to PSM, they will receive 9 VAI after fees (assuming feeIn = 10%), with 1 VAI going to the treasury and 8.1 VAI going to the user. The commission is calculated based on the principal amount of VAI (9 VAI = $9).

The VAI Savings Rate (VSR) contract is a smart contract designed to accept deposits of VAI tokens and mint SavingsVAI for depositors. This contract provides users with the opportunity to earn interest on their VAI deposits, while also providing additional utility to the VAI token within the Venus ecosystem.

Key features of the VSR contract include:
- Deposit and mint: Users deposit VAI into the VSR contract, which mints and issues SavingsVAI tokens to the depositor based on the deposit amount of VAI.
- Redeem and withdraw: Users can redeem their SavingsVAI tokens at any time, receiving VAI in return. The amount of VAI received upon redemption will always be equal to or greater than the initial VAI deposit used to obtain the SavingsVAI tokens.
- SavingsVAI: SavingsVAI is an ERC-20 token that represents a redeemable deposit within the VSR contract. The redemption process is guaranteed and immediate, without any lock-up periods.
- Implementation of ERC-4626: The VSR contract can implement the ERC-4626 standard (ERC-4626: Tokenized Vaults), where VAI serves as the resource and SavingsVAI functions as shares.

The VAI Savings Rate contract introduces an additional level of utility for VAI, allowing users to earn interest on their deposits. This mechanism not only encourages the holding of VAI but also improves the overall value proposition of the Venus ecosystem.

In conclusion, this proposal aims to keep the pegged VAI price at $1 by deploying the VAI PEG Stability module and providing liquidity for the VAI/USDT pair on PancakeSwap. The plan begins with the use of treasury for providing liquidity on PancakeSwap and continues with further developments, such as Peg Stability Modules, VAI Savings Rate, and updates to the liquidation sequence.
3-part series on MakerDAO resources concludes with information about Collateral and Liquidations. Previous parts covered related topics.

A proposal by Cattin (Seed Latam) requests 500,000 ARB for a challenge due to its potential impact. The initial application and an addendum can be found on the Arbitrum Foundation forum. Further details are available in the discussion threads provided.

The text discusses the nomination process for the ApeCoin DAO's Special Council, established by AIP-137. Community members have been discussing and providing feedback on nominees since November 28th. Voting is now open to choose the 5 candidates who will proceed to the Special Council election, scheduled from Dec 22-28. The process is administered by the Ape Foundation, with potential changes for security, usability, or to protect APE holders. More details can be found on the nomination announcement and nominee profiles posted on Discourse.

The text discusses a proposal to adjust inflation rates for the cryptocurrency SUSHI. Current community proposals suggest drastic reductions in block rewards, which could harm APY for liquidity providers and potentially drive them away, reducing competition with other Automated Market Makers (AMMs). The authors argue that lowering inflation too early could be harmful to the ecosystem, while existing proposals create imbalances among different user groups.

The text identifies three primary user groups: farmers who provide liquidity, holders of SUSHI, and casual traders seeking high liquidity. All are essential for the ecosystem's survival. The proposed solution is a gradual decrease in block rewards over time with less inflation in the long term to satisfy all parties.

The plan includes:
- First month: 150 SUSHI per block and $10mln buyback from funds received from @chefnomi
- Second month: 100 SUSHI per block and $4mln buyback
- Next ten months: 80 SUSHI per block
- Final year: 50 SUSHI per block

This plan aims to reduce inflation significantly after one year, with a slower and less damaging drop. The buyback is intended to offset the impact of inflation on price, and any locking mechanism for newly minted tokens would prevent instant sells of unlocked parts.

The text discusses a proposal by Aave Companies to introduce a new asset called GHO on the Aave Protocol, which allows users to mint against their collateralized crypto-assets. If approved, interest payments from GHO borrows will be sent to the AaveDAO. The community has provided feedback on potential pitfalls, such as DAO-set interest rates, supply caps, peg stability module, and facilitator vetting. A preliminary vote is being taken to receive community approval for the project, whitelist the first facilitator (Aave V2 Ethereum Market), and initiate discussions on starting parameters. The proposal aims to provide a strong initiation point for the AaveDAO to oversee GHO's development and parameters moving forward.

Resolv is a protocol that manages USR, a stablecoin backed by Ether collateral and pegged to the US Dollar. The stablecoin's design ensures price stability through delta-neutral portfolios, and an insurance layer (RLP) provides additional security. Key features include transparency, capital efficiency, profitability, and optimization for investment. Resolv aims to develop secondary liquidity for USR, primarily on the Curve USR-USDC pool, to facilitate integrations with leverage DeFi protocols. The governance token RSLV is forthcoming, and the protocol is currently audited by MixBytes and Pessimistic. It has been live since April 2024, with a current TVL of approximately $16 million and average yields for native USR staking and RLP at 9.16% APR and 19.36% APR respectively. Voting is currently live on Curve DAO and CrvHub.

This text appears to outline a series of interactions between the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig wallet and various GaugeAddresses on both Arbitrum and Ethereum networks. The interactions will involve seeding liquidity into several pools, including a GHO/GYD Pool with a range of -40bps to 2bps, a GHO/USDC/USDT Pool under Composable Stable, and possibly others.

   The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig wallet will call the addGauge function on the GaugeAdapter4 contract at the specified addresses with the provided arguments. These arguments include the gauge address and gauge type (Arbitrum or Ethereum) for each pool.

   It is important to note that TokenLogic and karpatkey, who are Service Providers and delegates within the Aave Ecosystem, are responsible for this proposal. This disclosure is included in the text.

This proposal suggests adjusting SUSHI emissions and introducing a lock-up period to encourage long-term participation in the ecosystem. The emission of new SUSHI will be reduced over five years, starting from 100 SUSHI per block, decreasing to 50, 25, and finally 10 SUSHI per block in subsequent years. Two-thirds of newly issued SUSHI will be locked for a one-year vesting period, earning fees but not available for sale or voting until unlocked. The aim is to lower inflation, prevent over-dilution, and reduce downward pressure on the token price. This model could reward early participants, promote long-term involvement, and create a lockup for user upside, but may have potential issues if the token price doesn't rise quickly enough to support liquidity providers and impact the development fund.

This text appears to be a project overview for Metadomo, a platform that aims to bridge the gap between traditional loyalty point programs (LPPs) and Web3 technology. The project's key features include:

1. Cross-border redemption capabilities for LPP points, which is currently a challenge in the industry. They plan to demonstrate this at scale using Astar.

2. Blending Web2/Web3 experiences to make Web3 more accessible to general consumers, thereby driving mass adoption.

3. Stimulating their ecosystem via $DOMO cashback, using traditional revenue streams to ensure sustainability and incentivize user growth.

The project has achieved several milestones so far, including becoming a member of Astar Japan Labs, establishing partnerships with gaming and payment networks, and setting up a nationwide merchant redemption network in Japan and Hong Kong.

The roadmap includes immediate plans for public beta testing of Rewards Station, UI overhaul, increasing social presence, completing the Rewards Station beta, launching Metadomo Genesis NFTs, onboarding projects and clients, expanding into South Korea, and more.

Long-term goals include launching MetaLoyalty Profiles, $DOMO TGE, launching $DOMO Cashback incentives, launching a Loyalty Marketplace, targeting India, Indonesia, and more reward network integrations, and launching Plug & Play Loyalty for merchants.

The core team includes Tiarnan Takumi Lynch (Token and ecosystem design), Tyrone Lynch (CEO), and Huy Dinn (Head of Tech).

Links provided are to the project's website, Rewards Station, and LinkedIn profiles of the team members.

Support work includes creating FAQs, an introduction to Vocdoni, and guidelines for various types of votes. They've expressed excitement about Uniswap's growth and plan to provide insights on proposals. Their core values include long-term value creation, fairness, education, maintaining Uniswap's original mission, diversity and inclusion, transparency, independent decision-making, and openness to input. Here's a summary of the information provided:

1. Position Value, Mark Value, Unrealized PnL, and Floating Funding are key concepts in financial trading using Maison's platform.

2. Position Value is calculated by multiplying the number of contracts, multiplier, average entry price, and days until expiry, then dividing the result by 365.
   Mark Value is calculated similarly but uses the mark price instead of the average entry price.
   Unrealized PnL is the difference between Mark Value and Position Value.

3. Floating Funding is applied every 24 hours at 12:00 UTC, and a fee of 0.001% is imposed on these transactions.

4. The trading core specification includes an Ethereum asset layer, an on-chain orderbook hosted on an Optimism-based Appchain with Celestia DA for matching and settlement, and various stages for order placement, management, matching, querying, and security measures.

5. Maison's role is to provide a unique trading protocol that connects various staking and re-staking solutions, increase liquidity, offer hedging opportunities, and promote the adoption of re-staking solutions.

6. Maison expects Lido and Symbiotic to accept it as a member of the Lido Alliance, provide partnership benefits for business development, and represent Maison as an official partner.

7. Re-Staking yield swaps are expected to benefit both individual users and protocols like Lido and various re-staking solutions by enhancing liquidity, providing hedging opportunities, and enabling sophisticated investment strategies.

The text discusses a proposal by Synapse DAO to migrate liquidity and incentives from SushiSwap to Balancer and Aura platforms. This move aims to increase pool liquidity and reduce SYN emissions. Currently, the rewards contract distributes approximately $12,000 worth of SYN incentives daily to staked LPs in the SYN/ETH pool on SushiSwap.

The proposal suggests a gradual migration process: initially reallocating 15,000 SYN per week to Aura's Hidden Hand incentives for one voting cycle (two weeks), followed by an increase to 25,000 SYN per week and eventually 35,000 SYN per week. This migration is expected to deepen pool liquidity while reducing Synapse DAO's Pool 2 spend by 40%, saving over $2m worth of SYN per year.

To fully benefit from the voting incentives, all SYN/ETH Balancer LPs need to stake their liquidity on Aura. The success of this proposal will be evaluated after four months (after eight voting cycles). If no alternative is proposed, the incentive program will continue.

The text proposes a new feature for predictions where users can bet on the higher odds, guaranteeing a minimum return of 2.1x and refunding any excess. This system would prevent adjustments (up or down) and only reveal the outcome once it starts. Advantages include encouraging more betting activity, providing a more balanced win multiplier, and allowing for larger bets as current limits result in smaller wins with big bets due to unbalanced betting.

The author discusses a tool developed by Uniswap that allows users to easily declare themselves as delegates for their governance protocols. They suggest adding Aave to this list and have started writing the necessary code on Github. The author notes a potential issue: Aave has two governance tokens, AAVE and stkAAVE, but there's no straightforward method to provide Sybil access to both as one token. They invite suggestions for solving this problem. The author believes that this tool will significantly enhance the Aave ecosystem by making it easier to announce delegates, view delegate votes, and proposals in a single interface, rather than just on the governance forum page.

The text discusses a proposal to invest $50k in community proposals through the Conviction Voting app, an emerging tool for decentralized governance aimed at overcoming challenges such as plutocracy, vote-buying, and on-chain voter apathy. This pilot is particularly relevant to the DeFi landscape as it addresses the governance bottleneck in large distributed communities. The Conviction Funding program has been developed by multiple teams including Aragon One, 1Hive, BlockScience, and the Commons Stack. It will be run on an Aragon DAO with a treasury of 9k ANT (currently valued at $60,390). Proposal submissions and voting will start on August 27 and end on October 8.

Today's news about UniSwap raises concerns. To safeguard PancakeSwap users, we should collaborate with top-tier security analysts. Striving to be the most secure Decentralized Exchange (DEX) is our priority going forward.

The proposal aims to create a mission statement for the ApeCoin Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO), focusing on aligning stakeholders and streamlining decision-making processes. Josh Friedberg, a former professional skateboarder and co-founder of 411 Video Magazine, is leading this initiative. The mission statement will be developed through workshops facilitated by the Smithsonian's Lemelson Center for Invention and Innovation, with input from various community members. The process includes collecting and sharing survey information, remote group discussions, and translation services for multilingual communities. The timeline for this proposal is three months, starting in January 2023, with the costs estimated at an undisclosed amount to be paid in ApeCoin based on the previous 30-day average exchange rate. Any unspent funds will be returned to the APE Foundation at the conclusion of the process.

This week, the Venus Protocol team has been focusing on the Guardian migration and vault-based governance scenarios. The Vault audit by Peckshield is scheduled for November 2nd, with a delay due to document issues. The team is preparing the backend and frontend for the vault launch, blacklisting bankrupt accounts, changing liquidation incentives, and focusing on the stability fee after these tasks are completed. A VRT to XVS conversion contract/dApp is in progress, expected post-Vault launch. Business Development efforts involve due diligence with potential partners and expanding VAI's presence on crypto debit cards companies. Marketing plans are underway for the new XVS Vault, tokenomics, and features. Venus Protocol's key metrics show a 6% decrease in average total liquidity, a 16.3% increase in average total borrows, a 3.7% decrease in available liquidity, and a 7.4% decrease in utilization rate.

The text discusses Uniswap's liquidity incentive program which ended on November 17, distributing 20 million UNI over two months among four pools (WBTC/ETH, USDC/ETH, USDT/ETH, and DAI/ETH). The benefits include ongoing incentives for liquidity providers, maintaining liquidity, preventing fast distribution, and avoiding vesting issues. Drawbacks include farming and dumping of UNI, slower distribution, and potential favoritism towards certain assets. A new proposal suggests distributing UNI at half the rate for an additional two months (5 million UNI per month), with adjusted pool distributions. The consensus check question is whether to distribute UNI according to these specifications. The snapshot poll will be live from November 23 to 28, and if it passes with a minimum of 50,000 UNI in support, the initiative will move forward as a formal governance proposal.

The proposal to lower the UNI proposal submission threshold from 10M to 2.5M UNI has passed a consensus poll with strong support. The next step is to move this into a consensus check phase. A new proposal has been created on Fish.vote for this change, aiming for 10M delegate votes to become official. This proposal includes all necessary on-chain logic, reducing ambiguity in the vote. For more details, visit the full proposal at [Reduce the UNI proposal submission threshold to 2.5M]. The smart contract link is available on Etherscan. The governance forum post and previous snapshot poll links are provided for reference.

6s Capital Partners LLC (6sCP) is required to conduct an audit of its financial statements annually, as stated in the Credit Agreement. This requirement ensures oversight of the company's equity level, which impacts its credit access within limits set by the debt ceiling. The audit serves as a verification that the financial statements' numbers have been reviewed and inspected. For DAO participants in the non-bank lending space, audits are essential to ensure compliance with applicable documents. 6sCP completed its 2021 financial statement audit by Watkins Uiberall, PLLC, which was issued "clean" and shared with relevant parties. It is argued that annual GAAP audited financial statements should be a requirement for all DAO participants, similar to publicly traded companies.

Title: Enabling sUSDe/wstETH Pool with Uncapped Emissions on Balancer

   Summary: A proposal to enable a pool for staked ETH and USD assets, generating yields regardless of price stability. The pool uses USDe, which maintains stability through automated hedges, and wstETH from Lido, an Ethereum staking service. This pool aims to facilitate easier trading between high-yielding and large tokens on the chain without complex un-staking.

   Key Points:
   - The pool combines 50% ETH staked with Lido and 50% USD staked with Ethena.
   - Ethena and Lido use multi-signature wallets, with plans for decentralized governance in the future.
   - Both platforms rely on centralized parts but are trusted within the crypto ecosystem.
   - The pool's value lies in allowing users to trade without unstaking tokens, especially considering sUSDe's 7-day unstaking period.

   References:
   - Ethena: [Ethena Labs](https://ethena-labs.gitbook.io/ethena-labs/)
   - Lido: [Lido Finance](https://github.com/lidofinance/audits)

   Further Details: Available in the original text, including oracle, audit, centralization vectors, market history, and transaction details.

The proposal suggests the use of KPI Options, a financial instrument built on UMA's platform, to help manage and divest UNI's community treasury. Here's a summary of how it works:

1. Collateralize 1 $UNI token to create a KPI Option. The KPI metric tracked is TVL (Total Value Locked), with a starting point of $1.5b and a target of $3b by the end of the year.

2. If the TVL reaches $3b before expiry, the KPI Option becomes valuable, as it implies that the final value of the synth will be 0.5 UNI (calculated as current TVL / target TVL).

3. The treasury can sell these options for stablecoins via a Gnosis auction or other means. The sale funds the treasury with stablecoins, which can then be used to create a secondary market for the KPI Options using Uniswap's AMM pools.

4. At expiry, all KPI options can be settled and stablecoins withdrawn from LP positions.

5. The treasury now has stablecoins, effectively generating funds.

6. UNI stakeholders have incentives to increase TVL, as it benefits the value of their KPI Options.

7. Stablecoins are seen as crucial for long-term success for the UNI protocol, as they provide a stable store of value and facilitate transactions.

The proposal is based on Yam Finance's experience in building synthetics on UMA's platform and managing DAO treasuries. Relevant links to resources discussing KPI Options are provided.

This text discusses a proposal to integrate steakLRT, a restaking token from Steakhouse, into the Ethereum v3 Lido Instance on Aave. The motivation is to diversify and strengthen the Aave ecosystem by incorporating a novel restaking token. SteakLRT offers unique value propositions and additional yield opportunities through boosted points programs. Its integration will attract user deposits, support growth of the Lido instance, and increase wstETH deposit yield through looping strategies and liquidity mining. The proposal will proceed to Snapshot and ARFC stages if consensus is reached, with community and service provider feedback collected at each stage. ACI, who proposed this, has no direct affiliation with Steakhouse but some team members are investors in Mellow.

This text discusses potential risks and a proposed action related to a legal case involving Lido-DAO. The risks include the possibility that third parties could seek to use default judgments against Lido DAO or other parties, which could lead to the dismantling of web2 infrastructure related to Lido-DAO.

The main risk of passing the proposed action is that the claimant in this case might argue that Lido-DAO is a legal person capable of being sued and suffering an adverse judgment. If Lido-DAO appears in court and is not dismissed from the case, it would face additional expenses and risks as the litigation proceeds.

The proposed action is to authorize Dolphin CL, LLC to file a motion to dismiss the legal case against Lido-DAO as quickly as possible. This motion would be funded through RCC EasyTrack motions up to 200,000 DAI if the proposal passes. Stephen Palley of Brown Rudnick is leading this effort and has extensive experience in litigating complex commercial matters, particularly in the digital asset space.

The goal of this action is to prevent the potential attack vector of a default judgment from materializing, as it could be difficult for the plaintiffs to enforce such a judgment and it would be better if it did not occur in the first place. However, if Lido-DAO were to appear in court and not be dismissed, it would face additional expenses and risks as the litigation proceeds.

Title: Onboarding sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum

Ethena is seeking community support for integrating sUSDe into Aave V3. Ethena is a synthetic dollar protocol built on Ethereum, offering a decentralized solution for money independent of traditional banking systems. The protocol's stable crypto-native asset, USDe, achieves stability through delta-hedging staked Ethereum collateral.

USDe has already seen significant usage in DeFi, making it an interesting addition to Aave v3. It is currently the 4th highest volume asset on Ethereum, and its liquidity on Curve is over $100m. USDe's high yield is expected to create strong borrow demand for looping strategies similar to sDAI.

The protocol aims to build a cooperative relationship with GHO, and the addition of sUSDe as collateral may lead to increased borrow demand. Users can acquire USDe through permissionless external liquidity pools and complete cross-market arbitrage by minting and redeeming USDe with Ethena and trading it in external markets like Binance or Curve pools.

However, the protocol is exposed to various risks such as smart contract risk, liquidity risk, custodial operational risk, exchange counterparty risk, market risk, among others. If consensus is reached, the proposal will move through several stages before a final AIP vote for implementation. The Aave Chan Initiative did not receive compensation for creating this proposal.

The proposal aims to establish a Balancer gauge for an 80% SD - 20% MaticX pool on the Polygon network. SD is a protocol token used for governance decisions, rewarding liquidity providers, and incentivizing veBAL voters. The motivation behind this move is to build additional liquidity for SD on Balancer, as it's currently the largest market for Stader. MaticX, with its significant liquidity pool on Balancer Polygon, is considered an ideal pairing for SD due to lower impermanent loss. The proposed pool could potentially become the primary source of liquidity for SD on Polygon. The SD and MaticX contracts are audited by Halborn and Immunebytes, with a Bug Bounty worth $1M currently live on Immunefi. Stader Labs provides further details on their governance mechanism, oracles, audits, centralization vectors, market history, and value in their respective resources.

Gauntlet is a quantitative research firm specializing in DeFi, focusing on treasury and risk management, incentive optimization, and mechanism design. They aim to be a delegate for Uniswap governance, contributing their technical expertise to advance the protocol's long-term impact. Their goals include running sustainable incentive programs, evaluating fee switch parameters, expanding Uniswap v3 deployments multichain, improving governance processes, and increasing delegate engagement in the DAO. Gauntlet has previously analyzed various aspects of the Uniswap ecosystem, providing resources on incentive design, Arbitrum rewards, fees, price execution, user cohorts, and more. They have no conflicts of interest with Uniswap's direct competitors.

Voting Cycle 4 for OP Governance Season 1 begins on July 21 and ends on August 3. This is the final voting cycle of the season, followed by a 3-week break. The voting will take place on Snapshot. There are six proposals for voting: Rocket Pool, Boardroom, dHedge, xToken Terminal and Gamma Strategies, Beefy Finance, Byte Mason Product Suite, QiDao, BarnBridge, and GARD. Proposals with explicit delegate approval include Rocket Pool, Boardroom, dHedge, xToken Terminal and Gamma Strategies, Beefy Finance, Byte Mason Product Suite, and QiDao. The remaining proposals have not correctly followed the rules laid out in the Operating Manual.

Title: Mandate Inclusion of 'Build with $APE' Page for Projects Funded by ApeCoin DAO

Description: This proposal aims to guide more people into the ApeCoin community by requiring every project funded through the ApeCoin DAO, either via an AIP or the Banana Bill, to include a prominent 'Build with $APE' (or similar) menu item and corresponding webpage. The webpage should provide information about the ApeCoin DAO, benefits of owning $APE, and resources for learning more. This requirement will onboard new members into the ApeCoin community, encourage more people to purchase their membership via their first $APE, actively promote the ApeCoin ecosystem, and ensure that funded AIPs properly recognize the ApeCoin DAO's contribution and support.

Benefit to ApeCoin Ecosystem: Onboarding new members into the ApeCoin community, encouraging more people to purchase their membership via their first $APE, active promotion of the ApeCoin ecosystem, ensuring that funded AIPs properly recognize the ApeCoin DAO's contribution and support, reducing friction for potential new members to become more involved, enhancing the Network Effect which occurs as the community grows.

Steps to Implement: Adjusting legal language in AIP and Banana Bill funding documents to require the above. This would require assistance from the Foundation and appropriate legal teams to establish appropriate legalese and finer details. The completion timing for this AIP shall be at the discretion of the Foundation and appropriate legal counsel, and should ideally be less than 30 days from the successful passing of this AIP, and before any funding from the Banana Bill is distributed.

Reporting Expectations: There would be no reporting expectations from this AIP as the entirety of this AIP consists of a relatively minor one-time change of future AIP and Banana Bill grant agreements.

Overall Cost: Total amount requested from the ApeCoin Ecosystem Fund = $0.

The Content Production Core Unit has provided an update focusing on administrative and content production progress. They've formed an LLC for legal protection, set up a business bank account, created job ads, conducted interviews, and hired a writer, video producer, and made an offer to a social media/community manager.

In terms of content production, they have collaborated with other Core Units on various projects such as the development of a Talent Portal, publishing videos, audios, and transcriptions of AMAs, hosting discussions, and creating episodes for Maker Relay. They are also planning updates to the Community Portal and will soon announce details for a Mascot Logo Contest.

In the coming weeks, they plan to continue work on the Community Portal, start producing educational videos, host an AMA with Centrifuge and Tinlake, strategize with GovComms to expand the scope of Maker Relay, and more. Regular updates can be found on their Transparency Dashboard and weekly Office Hours are held every Tuesday at 14:30 UTC.

The long-term stability of the DAI peg relies on MakerDAO focusing on its core competencies, which are creating permissionless software for generating and using Dai, managing on-chain risk, and handling on-chain assets. Maker should not engage in underwriting private credit or complex financial instruments as it lacks a competitive advantage in these areas. Instead, it is better suited to platforms like Compound, Notional, or Gnosis that build on top of the Maker protocol's stablecoin.

Maker can scale by returning to its original promise of value creation and exiting the business of picking winners and losers in complex financial and legal arrangements. Stablecoins should remit yield to Maker if they are over-reserved, or else exposure managed by drawing down those reserves for liquid, high-quality public bonds that return all net interest income back to the Surplus Buffer in DAI.

Existing partnerships with RWA providers and stablecoins should be evaluated regularly but not automatically offboarded. The workforce may be reduced if necessary, with every effort made to find productive uses for existing contributors and core units.

The MKR token's value proposition is derived from its governance role, and the protocol acting as the end buyer for MKR tokens is a simple, powerful narrative that is easy to understand, difficult to game, and trivial to track the progress of MKR burning. The traditional MKR tokenomics should be reaffirmed â where MKR dilution occurs in the event of insolvency, and MKR deflation occurs in the event of excess protocol DAI accumulation.

The MIP101 proposal should not be approved as it irrevocably locks MakerDAO into the End Game plan. GFX Labs will take the lead in authoring any required proposals to refocus Maker after rejecting the End Game plan, inviting collaboration from members of the workforce and holders of MKR.

This document discusses a proposal (MIP40c3-SP93) to modify the Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget (SF-001). The proposal outlines questions regarding the use of assets produced with MakerDAO funding, including whether they will be made public goods for the DAO. Questions also cover licensing, copyright, communication channels, and trademark registration related to these assets. The author is asked if they are familiar with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy and if they plan to integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in their Github repositories. The source code/material for the assets is also asked to be made publicly available, with details on how this will be done. Finally, the proposal asks whether the core unit plans to ensure relevant communication channels are under the ownership of the Dai Foundation to maintain Maker Governance control.

The text proposes a 50,000 USD bounty from the Aave v2 Ethereum ecosystem's reserve for a security disclosure by the Hacxyk team regarding a misconfigured fallback oracle on Aave v3 markets. More details can be found on the Aave governance forum.

This text is a guide on how to convert an existing Dapp into a Compound Extension using React.js or Vanilla JS. The guide includes instructions on installing the necessary dependencies, adding a shim to apply bindings when creating the Web3 provider object, and passing data from the Compound starter app to the embedded extension application.

For those using React.js, the guide provides an example of how to use the `useMemo` and `useEffect` hooks from 'react' along with the `RPCWeb3Provider` and `buildRPC` functions from '@compound-finance/comet-extension'. This allows the dapp to seamlessly fit into the Compound starter app as an Extension.

For those using Vanilla JS, the guide provides an example of importing libraries like Web3.js or Ethers.js along with the Comet Extension library and enabling the injected provider. In this example, the CometExtension object is used to create the provider. If the URL includes the embedded parameter, the Comet Extension library will create a provider object.

The guide concludes by encouraging developers to share their code with the community before reviewing the pull request instructions in the central Compound Extension repository and providing links to the Compound Discord server and community forums for further assistance.

The text discusses a proposed solution to address the risk associated with stETH in the Aave protocol during a bear market. The proposal includes introducing negative supply rates for stETH liquidity providers (LPs) to share and mitigate risks, and incentivizing ETH liquidity on DEX pools.

The negative supply rate will consist of a fixed Risk added rate and a variable Depegging added rate. The Risk added rate will be a percentage charged until stETH unstaking is available, while the Depegging added rate depends on the ETH/stETH ratio and encourages LPs to stabilize the peg.

To attract more ETH liquidity, an incentivization program will be implemented using fees collected from the negative supply rate for stETH LPs. The yield amount for this program is expected to range between 10%APY to 20%APY.

The text also suggests creating a new aETH/stETH pool and reaching out to platforms like Curve, Convex, and Lido to increase their reward programs for the next few months. The aim is to grow the yield amount of the Curve ETH/stETH pool and attract more ETH liquidity.

The proposal is still under discussion, improvement, and technical implementation by the Aave development team. If the incentivization program does not meet expectations, alternative solutions like advertising or increasing ETH supply on the Curve stETH/ETH pool may be considered.

The text discusses a proposal to address an issue with the allocation of Balancer (BAL) emissions in a recently approved CREAM/WETH gauge. The proposed solution involves setting guidelines for all future and existing gauges, requiring the underlying pool's owner to be Balancer Governance, or presenting a valid reason if not. If the owner is not Balancer Governance, any change to the swap fee must be communicated to the Balancer community in advance and approved by them. Failure to comply with these guidelines may lead to the gauge being terminated by the Emergency subDAO if they deem the swap fee change malicious. The text also mentions a potential risk of a governance attack by actors who might have enough voting power to vote down this proposal on snapshot. If this happens, it is suggested that the Emergency subDAO be petitioned to terminate the gauge. The guidelines, if approved, will immediately and retroactively take effect.

This proposal aims to update [BIP-198] regarding the Ecosystem Council covered by the DAO's self-insurance fund. The council consists of major participants and service providers within the Balancer protocol ecosystem. Their role is to seek independent legal counsel for confirming the use of funds from the self-insurance fund, which covers unbudgeted litigation costs and government fines incurred as a result of commissioned work on behalf of the Balancer ecosystem. The council includes representatives from Balancer Labs, the Balancer Foundation, Balancer OpCo, Balancer Maxis, Balancer Grants, BDSP, Beethoven X, Hypernative, and Karpatkey. The funds will be disbursed only after verification by legal counsel that the costs are directly related to Balancer work and not covered under any other insurance. The Ecosystem Council meets regularly as needed for coordination on ecosystem plans, as outlined in [BIP-1] Operating Framework for Balancer DAO.

A proposal has been made to establish a bi-directional communication channel between Shiden Network and Bit.Country Pioneer. This will enable the transfer of $SDN on Bit.Country Pioneer for use in their NFT marketplace and Metaverse, while $NEER can be used within the Shiden Network ecosystem. The process involves both chains requesting and accepting HRMP channels via their respective governance procedures. Technical details include waiting for approval, executing extrinsic calls with the parachain's sovereign account, and ensuring sufficient KSM as collateral and for fees.

In April 2023, the Arbitrum Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) approved a proposal to diversify 35 million ARB tokens into various stable, liquid, and yield-bearing assets. The appointed committee has recommended 30 service providers for this purpose. The top recommendations are Securitize BUIDL (11 million), Ondo USDY (6 million), Superstate USTB (6 million), Mountain USDM (4 million), OpenEden TBill (4 million), and Backed Finance bIB01 (4 million). This vote aims to approve or reject these service providers for ArbitrumDAO's treasury diversification under the first iteration of the STEP program. A 'yes' vote instructs the Arbitrum Foundation and program manager to execute the recommendations, while a 'no' vote will prompt the committee to reconsider based on delegates' concerns.

The text discusses Voting Delay, which refers to the time gap between a proposal submission and the start of voting (snapshot taking). Currently, it's set at one block. The question raised is whether this period should be extended.

The framework outlined in this text appears to be a support structure within the MakerDAO decentralized autonomous organization (DAO). The team's primary role is to offer call support, initiative tracking, and reporting on initiatives' status and progress. They also focus on emergency communication support, documentation of the emergency response process, education efforts within the DAO, and acting as a communications manager during emergencies or incidents.

The team has made significant strides in various areas:

2. Initiatives Tracker & Stakeholder Alignment: Iterations have been made on a proposal for how Maker should describe and group its initiatives.

4. Engagement: Improvements have been made to the Issue Discussion Call's procedural documentation, and efforts have been made towards GDPR compliance for the Stakeholder Database.
5. DAO-Facing Work: The team provides various resources, updates, and reports on the MakerDAO forum, weekly relay, and governance review.

The team is also working on rethinking GovComms, finalizing agreements on new admin costs, and making progress on a Communications Audit. They are also exploring partnerships with other teams like Immunifi Security CU for documentation and education efforts in emergency communications support. The team expects a mandate refresh soon and continues to service active programs while remaining flexible for optimization.

The text discusses a proposal for instant redemption of Venus (XVS) tokens in the Venus Vault. Currently, users must wait 7 days to access their tokens, which can cause missed opportunities during Binance events such as launchpad or pool. However, due to borrow limits and risks associated with using all circulating XVS as collateral, not all tokens can be used for instant redemption.

TechOps Core Unit handled 181 incidents in May, primarily involving AWS infrastructure, EC2, Governance App, Nodes, Oracle Security Module, Oracles and Feeds, Poke Keeper, Vulcanize DB, and more. They also worked on community tasks such as Discord management, Zoom account configuration, and Google Analytics integration with the Maker Community Forum. The text discusses changes to the supply and borrow caps for three assets on Venus: BUSD, MATIC, and PLANET. For BUSD, efforts are being made to wind down the market due to Paxos stopping support in February 2024. This includes freezing new supply and borrow, increasing reserve factor, pausing mint and borrow, pausing entering market, setting rewards to 0, adjusting IR curves, implementing a forced liquidation mechanism, repayment of insolvent accounts, and gradually reducing the Collateral Factor for BUSD. For MATIC, the supply cap is currently at 86% utilization, and it's recommended to double the supply cap to 16M MATIC. For PLANET, the current supply and borrow caps are being increased from 2B to 4B and 1.5B to 1.5B respectively, based on a calculated ratio and considering user positions that show a trend of supplying and simultaneously borrowing the asset. These changes aim to manage risk and accommodate for changing market conditions.

On E29 of the podcast, Chamath discusses unions. He believes that current unions lack effectiveness due to lacking data and facts. He suggests a modernized version of unions, involving young, intelligent individuals who can redefine the role of unions. Friedberg adds that unions could be seen as the epitome of a free market system, similar to a group starting their own business.

User and project support included adding new pools and tokens to the UI, ongoing Discord and Telegram activity, weekly UI testing, and coordinating with contributors for value-added contributions. The monthly community call is scheduled for July 27th.

DAO development work includes launching an optimized veBAL calculator and BPT estimator on Balancer Tools, releasing a price impact and swap simulator, migrating analytics to the official balancer subgraph, and improving documentation.

The team is working on organizing information in the Maxi notion and conducting a health-check survey for July. A new Coordinape framework has been published and contributors are undergoing onboarding. The July community call with the Maxis will be held today.

The proposal aims to add a veBAL gauge for the 50/50 tBTC/WBTC pool on Ethereum. The pool and gauge links are provided. The specifications involve interactions between the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig and the GaugeAdderv4 contract to add the gauge for the tBTC/WBTC pool.

On October 27th, an XSS vulnerability was discovered on the MIPs Portal by a whitehat. This allowed malicious users to manipulate the website's appearance and behavior under the official domain name. The vulnerability enabled users to inject scripts into the client side of the website, potentially bypassing access controls, redirecting to other sites, or creating transactions or contract interactions. GovAlpha addressed the issue by sanitizing all website inputs, adding code logic to analyze and remove any HTML or JavaScript entered by users. After testing, the vulnerability appears to have been removed. The whitehat was paid 2,500 DAI for their findings, as the MIPs Portal is currently not part of Immunefi's Bug Bounty Program. Efforts are being made to include it in the future. Users are advised to be cautious when opening links from unofficial sources.

Title: Independent Proposal Submission by Stewards in Working Groups

Description: This proposal, put forward by @bigbull, suggests that if a Steward is part of a Working Group and wishes to propose an idea related to that group, they should first consult the group and the Stewards. If the majority refuses, the proposal can still be submitted with a disclaimer. Proposals unrelated to the working group follow the current process without requiring approval from the related group. This applies to existing (Governance, Marketing and Communications, Metaverse Working and Web3 Development Groups) and future groups.

Benefits: Clarifies the distinction between personal proposals and implied endorsements from working groups, enhances communication and collaboration among working group Stewards, and ensures better growth of the Working Groups as Stewards have short terms.

Implementation: The proposal will take effect once approved and continue until replaced. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) will be used to track the number of AIPs initiated by each Steward within their working group and the number of AIPs put up for vote, with updates provided quarterly. Slack will be used for internal votes tracking.

Reporting Expectations: Working groups will report on how many times they accepted or rejected the first right of refusal to author an AIP strictly within the core focus of that working group. The Secretary Initiative will handle KPI updates.

Cost: No funds are requested from the ApeCoin Ecosystem Fund.

The text discusses a proposal to increase trading volume on a platform, aiming to reduce dependence on BAL rewards. The solution suggests implementing a market-making program with verified providers, offering rebates on fees traded. This strategy has proven successful in traditional CEX exchanges. The proposed experiment involves a 2-month trial with a capped pool of 150k USD equivalent. Verified providers suggested include aggregators like 1inch and matcha, as well as platforms like zerion and zapper.

The author also mentions three types of products that can be built on the platform: smart routing (e.g., 1inch, Paraswap), wallet information (e.g., debank, Zerion), and potential future unforeseen products. The focus is on attracting trading volume from group 2 and 3 products, which include platforms that users trust enough to perform swaps without worrying about underlying prices, and new products that could potentially introduce more trading volume.

The author emphasizes the importance of addressing UI/UX issues before implementing this strategy, as it may encourage the development of products in group 3. The ultimate goal is to increase trading volume on the platform.

The proposal aims to add gauge support for the BetSwirl pool on Arbitrum, which is a web3 casino where users own a share of the house and are rewarded a share of its revenue. The pool is paired with 20% wstETH and a 2% capped gauge would be appropriate due to the AUM. BetSwirl isn't in DAO mode yet, but their treasuries multi-sigs own all contracts. The pool is intended to be the secondary source of liquidity for the token. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 to add the gauge. BetSwirl can be found on their website, documentation, GitHub page, Discord, Telegram, Dune, Token Terminal, and DefiLlama.

The text is about a scheduled call on March 9, 2023, related to MakerDAO governance. The Zoom waiting room will be active with a password (748478). If participants are not admitted from the waiting room, they should notify in the #governance channel of the Maker Discord. The call will cover a Governance Round-Up, Initiative Update, and a Main Topic discussion on MIP101: The Maker Constitution. The communication is for informational purposes only and does not represent official policy or position of MakerDAO. It should not be relied upon as professional advice in any field.

Discussion scheduled for April 20th, 16:00 UTC about the NEAR Protocol's Rainbow Bridge. Topics include understanding NEAR, the Rainbow Bridge, its security, relation to MakerDAO, and usage of Dai on NEAR. Special guest is Alex Shevchenko from NEAR Protocol. Resources provided for further reading.

The text proposes extending the duration of syrup pools on Pancakeswap, currently set at an unknown length, to 120 days with a reduced APR (Annual Percentage Rate) of around 30%-40%. This change aims to make the syrup pools last longer, benefiting both new and existing projects by providing them more time to launch or extend their syrup pools. Additionally, it intends to alleviate investor concerns about dumping CAKE when large pools expire.

0xMaki, the founder of SushiSwap, is proposed to receive a one-time founders grant and focus full time on the project. The grant includes an upfront payment of 250k SUSHI, monthly vested payments of 750k SUSHI over three years, and additional rewards for project milestones. This will make Maki the head of the core team, responsible for building out SushiSwap. The community can revoke unvested SUSHI if Maki stops working on SushiSwap. Future votes may establish further budget and bonuses based on performance. Maki will present a plan, budget proposal, and guidelines for the community's decision-making process.

Arbitrum DAO submitted a request for 250,000 ARB due to a late application. This requires a closer look as per the rules for automatic challenges. The initial application was made by Sanko GameCorp and an addendum followed.

The ApeCoin DAO has established a nomination process for its Marketing and Communications Working Groups through AIP-246. Community members can apply and their profiles are posted on Discourse for discussion. Voting is now open for 5 candidates who will move to the election vote, scheduled for June 13 - 19, 2024. The candidates are @Brazy, @Hiisver, @LMAC, @shotgun.tobi, @Temuulen, @Xavierfreeway, @Yumi. For more information, refer to the Marketing and Communications Working Group Nomination Announcement and AIP-246.

This community poll aims to set a temporary voting threshold for SushiPowah proposals, as there currently isn't a clear minimum requirement. The community hasn't voted on this threshold yet, and the lack of a team for core proposals complicates matters. This vote will determine the minimum number of votes needed to pass a proposal using a weighted average. Voting in favor of this poll means agreeing that the new threshold should be applied retroactively to the Sushi buyback proposal, but it won't affect other votes until a core team is hired and proposes a more comprehensive DAO structure. The goal is to provide clearer guidance for the multisigs regarding community consensus on fair minimum voting thresholds.

Afternoon! Suggestion is to establish a burn staking pool to encourage token price growth. The cake community might be interested and invest Cake tokens. Current burning rate is insufficient, leading to excessive coin circulation and slow token price growth.

Title: Proposal to Add Gauges for DFX Finance Pools on Balancer

   Summary: The proposal aims to incentivize liquidity migration and increase trading volumes by adding gauges for the DFX/ETH 50/50 and DFX/TEL/USDC 40/40/20 pools within the Balancer ecosystem.

   Description: DFX Finance is a decentralized foreign exchange protocol facilitating stablecoin swaps with low volatility. It has over $40M TVL, and DFX tokens serve as governance for the protocol.

   Key Points:
   1. Governance: DFX tokens enable voting on governance proposals through Snapshot. Plans to transition to a veDFX model are underway.
   2. Oracles: Uses Chainlink for real-world forex price feeds.
   3. Audits: Engaged with multiple auditors including Trail of Bits, Haechi, and Zellic.
   4. Centralization vectors: Treasury functions controlled by a 2/4 multisig.
   5. Market History: DFX has been transferable since March 2021, with the oldest pool on Balancer being 230 days old and currently $420,000 worth of DFX liquidity on Balancer.

   References: Visit DFX Finance's website, dApp, documentation, Gitbook, Medium, Github, Telegram, and Discord communities for more information. Price history can be found on Coingecko.

The text expresses enthusiasm for creating a POAP (Proof of Participation) for PCS fans, suggesting it could be a Christmas-themed POAP. The author also mentions disappointment at seeing Sushi POAPs and invites the reader to join them on Discord.

The user has money blocked due to collateral supply, but the platform indicates no borrowed amount when there is 1K. The user is unable to repay and free their collateral. They seek advice on how to repay their borrowed BUSD.

Starting next Monday, AlphaGrowth-supported Torque will distribute ARB tokens to USDC borrowers. The contract for claiming ARB can be viewed here. Real-time reward accrual values are available on the dashboard in their application. Torque also won a grant from CGP 2.0 to develop refinancing, with more details available at Questbook. For those unfamiliar with Torque, check out our previous thread. Further updates on initiatives will be provided here. Links provided for site, app, documents, Telegram, and GitHub.
