The Collateral Maintenance component (CML) of MakerDAO focuses on managing collateral to ensure the protocol's health. This involves continuous evaluation, monitoring, reporting, adjusting, and making decisions about Maker collateral. Key stakeholders include the CES Core Unit, Risk Core Unit, Data Insights Core Unit, and Real World Finance Core Unit.

The Collateral Operations process is a proactive activity that monitors the health of Maker collateral to assist in knowing when to take action on specific collateral types or categories. This includes both on-chain and off-chain collateral types.

The initial high-level deliverable for this component is CMD1 - Collateral Operations, which aims to implement the first iteration of the Collateral Operations process to proactively manage Maker collateral. This will be followed by smaller deliverables identified during stakeholder alignment work and tracked within a project management framework.

The operations focus provides ongoing reporting of results, with the first iteration of the Collateral Operations process implementation scheduled for Q1/Q2 2022.

This is a high-level overview of the CES plan for the Collateral Maintenance component. The deliverables and metrics will become more specific as stakeholder dependencies and requirements are defined. Updates on progress and changes will be provided through ongoing communication formats and channels.

1. Permissionless DVT (Decentralized Validator Technology) operators allow for a more distributed network of Ethereum validators, but they still hold a significant amount of staked ETH on the network. Lido, as the largest stakeholder, currently controls almost 33.3% of all staked Ethereum.

2. The demand for products like Lido exists due to their convenience and ease of use compared to solo or pooled staking. However, concerns remain about the concentration of power in a single entity's hands. Some propose that Lido should self-pledge not to exceed a certain percentage (e.g., 25% - 30%) of all staked ETH to prioritize the Ethereum network over their own financial interests. However, this would require LDO holders to vote in favor of such a proposal, which is unlikely due to potential financial losses.

3. For solo stakers running machines from home, joining initiatives like Lido as a node operator can help decentralize the Ethereum network further by bringing validators out of data centers and into homes. DVT (Decentralized Validator Technology) makes these validators harder to tamper with due to their distribution.

4. The upcoming trial in early 2024 aims to significantly increase the number of home stakers, making it an excellent opportunity for those interested in participating as node operators to consider joining.

5. Spacesider is involved in several projects related to Ethereum staking, including DVStakers (an educational DVT community), Staking Directory (a community-maintained directory of Ethereum staking providers), and EthStaker (an educational staking community focused on maximizing decentralization of the network).

6. Eridian is an Ethereum staking enthusiast who maintains the EthStaker Knowledge Base and has worked on various Ethereum staking-related projects like DVStakers and Staking Directory. As a Community Lifeguard for Lido, Eridian supports the diversification of the Lido node operator set to enable thousands of solo stakers to participate in validating Ethereum.

3. Processed food consumption was linked with a higher likelihood of developing depression, especially in women.

4. The study suggests that diet may play a role in mental health and could be a potential target for prevention strategies.
Monthly updates available for Balancer Maxis.

The text provides recommendations for adjusting supply and borrow caps for various assets on Venus Pool based on Chaos Labs' methodology. Recommendations include increasing the UNI supply cap to 400,000, WBETH borrow cap to 8,000, ETH borrow cap to 60,000, USDC borrow cap to 200,000,000, TWT supply cap to 3,000,000, and USDT borrow cap to 1,100,000. The analysis for each asset considers user positions, market conditions, and liquidity. For FDUSD, the recommendation is to increase the supply cap to 30,000,000 due to increased trading volume and stable on-chain liquidity.

Title: Enhance Working Group Transparency

   Proposal by ALL CITY aims to improve communication and transparency within the ApeCoin DAO's Working Groups as they approach eleven Stewards with the addition of ApeChain. The proposal suggests mandatory reporting in quarterly transparency reports, covering key personnel, milestones, expenditure tracking, risk management, performance metrics, community impact, and personal achievements for each team member.

   To ensure effective communication among diverse Stewards, a collective vote by all Working Group Leads every six months will be implemented. This proposal benefits the ApeCoin ecosystem by promoting improved collaboration, increased accountability, building community confidence, reducing risk, enhancing resource allocation, and attracting talent. The proposal has no associated costs.
The Venus Whitepaper provides comprehensive information about the project. It is recommended to review it before asking questions as it likely contains the answers you seek.

Title: DeepSpy - Smart Contract Security Project

   Description: A team is proposing the development of DeepSpy, a smart contract security project that uses artificial intelligence to identify vulnerabilities in smart contracts. The project will be supported by the Astar Network and aims to run on EVM and WASM supported networks. The team consists of full-time members Bugra, Eren, Yigit, and assistants Cagri, Mesude, and Aybars. Other part-time members include Ata. Mentors will guide the project's progress.

   Roadmap: The roadmap includes data collection, transformation into meaningful data, AI model implementation to find security vulnerabilities, beta version release, and main version release.

   Budget: The budget includes hardware such as a Lenovo Legion 5 Pro laptop, Mega cloud storage, and an Azure OpenAI Service subscription. Additionally, Kingston KC3000 SSD is required for the project.

   Sustainability: The project's sustainability depends on the grant from the Astar Network to meet essential hardware requirements. Given its security-based nature, the project can function in various contexts where smart contracts are available.

   Participation of Project Interest Groups: Mentors will act as consultants and guide the progress of the project. The team members have defined roles, with Bugra, Eren, and Yigit working full-time on the project.

A decision has been made to implement a hybrid oracle for pricing Liquid Staking Tokens (LSTs), aiming to optimize security and scalability. The Chainlink Labs team will design this oracle, with Gauntlet providing feedback. The proposed implementation involves a decentralized oracle network tracking the ETH collateral backing an LST. For additional security, results could be compared with the LST issuer's primary and secondary market rates.

Gauntlet suggests deploying exchange rate pricing oracles across current LST/LRT markets during the development of the hybrid oracle. This strategy aims to boost Compound's TVL and revenue by enabling wstETH as collateral earlier and shielding other markets from market price-dependent risks. The plan is to transition to the new oracles once development and audits are complete.
The proposal to hire 0xMaki is commendable, but suggested Sushi amount seems excessive. If passed, adjust proposed Sushi amounts accordingly.

The text proposes a change to allow any eligible pool to function as a basepool for Stableswap-NG metapools without admin approval, currently only whitelisted pools can serve this role. This change aims to make pool creation more permissionless and flexible, potentially encouraging novel developments in the stablecoin market. The current whitelist procedure can be bypassed using LP tokens, but this approach lacks the user-friendly interface of "proper" metapools. If approved, a new admin contract will be deployed to enable permissionless use of the add_base_pool method, with other safeguards remaining in place. The change may potentially divert liquidity from existing basepools but could also facilitate new approaches and preferences in the market.

Title: Application of Astarhub to dApp Staking Program

   Summary: Gunit, Astar's ambassador and founder of Astarhub, along with Igporoshin, aims to apply Astarhub to the dApp Staking program. Astarhub is an educational platform and information hub for the Astar Network and its ecosystem. It provides essential information about projects launched on Astar and Shiden Network, tutorials, articles, a beginner's guide, and supports 12 different languages. The platform also includes a review system, surveys, and a rewards pool to encourage user participation. An educational campaign named #LearnUseEarn is being launched to teach users about the Astar EVM and WASM ecosystems. The development roadmap includes improvements in reviews, widgets for dApp websites, surveys, B2E reward distribution, a faucet, and enhancements to existing pages.

The text describes a mission aimed at making Optimism a dominant platform for trading and creating yield-bearing assets. It incentivizes the importation of $70,000,000 worth of yield-bearing assets to Optimism, offering additional rewards in OP. Eligible assets include wstETH, rETH, cbETH, sfrxETH, USDM, USDY, and bI0B1. The mission requires a whitelist of eligible assets and protocols, with a process for asset issuers and protocols to apply for whitelisting. Progress will be measured by the number of yield-bearing assets whitelisted, amount bridged onto Optimism, duration of stay, and capital inflows. The success of the mission will be evaluated based on Total Value Locked (TVL) due to the attraction of additional assets. This is part of a broader strategy to attract Real-World Assets (RWAs), staked ETH, and other yield-bearing assets to Optimism.

The proposal aims to seek community approval for whitelisting Aragon's multisig wallet on Ethereum, allowing Aragon to lock its "B-80BAL-20WETH LP" position into veBAL. Motivation: Aragon, a governance and DAO infrastructure provider, is looking to engage in the meta-governance of relevant web3 projects like Balancer, as it transitions to a DAO at year-end. Specification: Whitelist Aragon's Gnosis safe multisig wallet address on Ethereum with the provided address (0x4e1556Ef7468d60c09A69278FED9d4680A9441fc). No significant risks have been identified.

The proposal aims to add a gauge for the Matic-MaticX pool on Balancer, with MaticX being a liquid token for Matic staking provided by StaderLabs. This move is intended to:

1. Build deep liquidity for staked Matic within the Polygon DeFi ecosystem, using incentives as a key mechanism.
2. Establish Balancer as the primary DEX for Matic-MaticX pool due to its metastable pool technology and potential to serve Matic-MaticX effectively.

StaderLabs, with over 770 million USD in total assets staked across multiple chains, is a leading candidate for unlocking liquidity through MaticX. The proposal expects significant liquidity and trading volumes to be brought into the Balancer ecosystem by this move.

The text proposes a simplified method for Fiat In/Out using credit cards or bank transfers for SushiSwap LP tokens on their main website (sushiswapclassic.org). This is achieved by integrating multiple third-party FIAT to Crypto providers, aiming to facilitate mass adoption of the project due to the complexity in acquiring SLPs currently.
A request for 375,000 ARB was proposed by L2BEAT in the final round of STIP for UmaFi (Uma Finance). The proposal requires closer examination due to an addendum provided.
The text suggests the process of accumulating a percentage for a longer period of commitment.

Agustin, a partnership lead for Composable Finance, proposes adding ATOM, the native token of Cosmos network, as collateral on Compound. The main rationale is ATOM's substantial liquidity and integral role in the Cosmos network. To make ATOM usable on Compound, IBC will be utilized as a bridging mechanism. This integration could enhance liquidity, provide opportunities for ATOM holders to leverage their assets, foster stronger connections between Ethereum and Cosmos ecosystems, and expand ATOM's utility within DeFi.

ATOM is a governance token that secures the Cosmos Hub through staking, accruing value via network fees and staking rewards. It has undergone several audits, ensuring trust and security. The proposal suggests conservative parameters for its inclusion on Compound, such as a maximum Loan-to-Value ratio and liquidation threshold and penalty in line with Compound's risk management practices.

The Inter-Blockchain Communication Protocol (IBC) will facilitate this integration, offering permissionless, secure, modular, and composable connections between blockchains. Composable, the first company to connect a non-Cosmos chain through IBC, aims to bring IBC to all chains, with Ethereum being a significant focus for secure interoperability.

The proposal seeks feedback on incorporating ATOM into Compound to boost liquidity and user interaction, leveraging IBC protocol and Composable's efforts in establishing secure cross-chain links. Support from the community and market makers is crucial for this well-founded plan to enhance Compound's position within the cross-chain DeFi ecosystem.

The author has completed their votes for Gov Fund Phase 1 Season 1. They express a general impression that most proposals are mediocre, with few high-quality projects. For Season 2, they will only vote for proposals from protocols with proven track records, clear incentives for usage on Optimism, and co-incentive programs with reasonable amounts. They also emphasize the need for decentralization features such as permissionless fraud proofs, decentralized contract upgradability, emergency upgrades, decentralized sequencers, and economic sustainability for OP tokens. The author is uncomfortable granting OP tokens while Optimism remains a centralized sidechain and calls for updates on the roadmap for these decentralization goals. They plan to be more cautious with their votes until Optimism improves in these areas.

The Gyroscope Protocol, currently in limited production on Polygon, is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol that will eventually be governed by a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO). Upon full launch on Ethereum, the FTL Labs multi-sig will have the ability to pause the pool, change the swap fee, and set the protocol fee. The E-CLP (Ethereum Constant Liquidity Pool) will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

The oracle for WMATIC is currently none, while the rateProvider1 for MATICX is managed by an address on Polygon. Audit reports for the protocol have been conducted by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification, with the E-CLP code being live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

There are no centralization vectors at this time, but the FTL Labs teamâs multi-sig can currently pause the pool, change the swap fee, and set the protocol fee. The market history for the Gyroscope Protocol can be accessed through links to the new pool and gauge on Polygon.

The value of the Gyroscope Protocol lies in its asymmetrically concentrated liquidity, which could potentially drive trading volume and total value locked. The contracts for the WMATIC/MATICX E-CLP, gauge on Polygon, and gauge on Ethereum mainnet have been provided.

In addition, the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at a specific address and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
- Gauge (address): `0x82bcaD0C8F51D88ec339141F0d8953Bc25cc3d8c`
- GaugeType (string): `Polygon`

Project Dhive, a governance and analytics platform, has received a grant from Arbitrum through Questbook. The goal of Dhive is to become a premier hub for governance data, offering users easy access to information, insights, updates, and monitoring tools. Key features include comprehensive data aggregation, a trusted credentials environment, and a custom notification system. Progress includes constructing the core architecture, indexing Arbitrum ecosystem on-chain data, setting up frontend, implementing web3 chain-agnostic credentials, and partnering with Mask Network. Dhive invites community engagement for ideas, questions, and insights via social media platforms like Twitter and Discord.

SEEDOrg, represented by wallet address 0xc1c2e8a21b86e41d1e706c232a2db5581b3524f8, is a Latam-based delegate platform participating in Lido Governance. SEEDGov, a vertical within the SEED Org ecosystem, focuses on decentralized governance in web3. The team aims to contribute significantly to Lido's leading liquid staking protocol, with active participation and meaningful engagement through dedicated teams and ad hoc consultants.

SEEDGov's mission is to shape the future of decentralized governance, minimize where appropriate, and professionalize it where necessary. They advocate for critical thinking, education, and do not endorse scams or collaborate with projects that are not aligned with their core values.

Their work spans across various projects and protocols, including managing grant and allocation programs, designing governance infrastructure, creating incentive programs, and onboarding builders to align with protocol needs. They prioritize community-led growth, sustainability, security, and decentralization in their approach.

SEEDGov sees Lido's potential impact on the ETH landscape and aims to contribute to its governance, focusing on areas like alliances, L2 expansion, and improving the governance process through their global understanding of the DeFi ecosystem. They will disclose any conflicts of interest if they arise.

The text describes a proposal for an outdoor digital billboard network aimed at benefiting the ApeCoin ecosystem. The initiative is self-funded and seeks community support to accelerate its success. Key features include:

1. 20% of revenue sent to ApeCoin DAO treasury until costs are recovered.
2. 10% rewards for referrals.
3. Ongoing royalties and free ads for the Ape community.
4. Bonus display time for $APE payments.
5. Free display space reserved for ApeCoin DAO use.
6. Recruitment of more $APE builders through a guide on the Public Bored website.
7. 25% of revenue converted into and held in $APE.

The total budget is 75,000 $APE, allocated across digital display truck, website & technology development, marketing, staffing, transportation, direct sales, miscellaneous expenses, and potential second/third event budgets. The Ape Foundation will administer the implementation of the proposal.

The text discusses an issue with Venus creating a LP (Liquidity Provider) at Ethereum with a limited amount of 8000XVS, which is insufficient for meeting prime demand due to high Ethereum chain fees. This results in high costs for bridging XVS tokens to Ethereum, making it unaffordable for many users, including whales who hold more than 1000XVS. The text suggests either increasing the limit at Venus or collaborating with Binance to support withdrawal of XVS from the first day as potential solutions. The author emphasizes the need for a more realistic increase in the bridge amount.

The Venus team has designed a solution to address Vai's off-peg issue, considering factors like code development complexity, security, and implementation difficulty. The plan is set to be released in the second half of the current week. The price of Vai, influenced by supply and demand, may deviate from its target of $1 due to oversupply. To rectify this, a VIP will temporarily halt the minting of Vai to control its total amount. This is just the beginning; the team aims to improve Vai's use cases and expand its scene in the future. The stability of Vai is seen as a foundation for growth in the decentralized stablecoin market.

This text discusses a proposal (EIP-7251) to increase the MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE in Lido protocol. A study was conducted to evaluate its potential impact on APR and slashing risks. The APR could increase from 0.000094% to approximately 0.001958%, with variations depending on network conditions and validator size. Validators of type 0x02 with a volume less than 1700ETH may see a marginal decrease in APR under normal conditions, but could be more effective during network overloads.

Consolidating to more than 100 validators under the same host does not significantly impact expected losses and can be utilized by large stakers, but increases uncertainty. Consolidating to a low number of validators leads to increased expected losses due to initial losses. The risks of incurring penalties increase with the consolidation of validators. The research findings suggest that there is no immediate need for support for this EIP and transition to type 0x02 validators, as the risks outweigh the benefits. Feedback and suggestions are welcome.

A Community Call titled "Let's Talk About Layer 2" is scheduled for April 13, 16:00 UTC. The discussion will feature guests Igor Barinov from xDai, Andrey Bugaevski from Incognito Protocol, and Kris Kaczor representing Maker Foundation and Optimism. Topics include the state of Layer 2s, ideas about MakerDAO L2 integrations, the impact of L1 scaling on L2 usage, and an open Q&A session. Relevant forum threads for further reading are provided.

This proposal aims to adjust five risk parameters across three Aave V2 assets, aligning with a chosen moderate risk level. The changes include lowering the liquidation threshold for CRV, following a community-approved Risk Off Framework. Gauntlet's simulation engine uses various data points to recalibrate the Aave protocol's parameters. These updates seek to maintain overall risk tolerance while making specific asset trade-offs. The updated liquidation thresholds are: CRV - 61%, DAI - 90%, WBTC - 80%. Users can monitor the impact of these changes on the Gauntlet Risk Dashboard.

The Aave development team is proposing a minor code addition to support native stkAAVE Liquidity Mining within Enzyme. Current Aave incentive contracts have a security issue due to their reliance on trusted originators of claiming transactions, which isn't suitable for abstractly-designed smart contract claimants like Enzyme vaults. This proposal includes adding an additional claiming function that uses msg.sender instead of to, reducing the need for trust in the transaction originator.

Enzyme is a decentralized asset management infrastructure on Ethereum, offering users superior DeFi tools. Since its v2 release, Enzyme has seen significant growth in TVL (Total Value Locked), outperforming ETH by nearly 1650%. High-profile managers like USF Fund and The Yang Express have had strong traction.

Enzyme Vaults offer various use cases, including yield farming strategies, long/short vaults, passive strategies, robo strategies, market making strategies, and more. By adding the proposed function, Enzyme aims to open up liquidity mining for its users, increasing AAVE adoption, tapping into a fast-growing community, and fostering closer collaboration between both projects. Notably, Enzyme contracts have been audited by PWC, Chain Security, and other leading auditors in the space.

The text discusses an Executive Summary for a proposed framework aimed at achieving self-governance in the PoS validator network. The goal is to have validators regulate themselves through agreed parameters for admission, participation, and exit from the network.

The proposal includes two parts: Part A focuses on network monitoring with technical performance measurement parameters such as checkpoints signed percentage and a 14-day interval for measuring compliance. Part B proposes remedial action standards for non-compliance, including a grace period for correcting deficiencies before forced exit through unbonding stake.

The framework encourages input from the validator community to refine the proposed parameters and reach consensus before moving towards adoption by a community vote. The ultimate goal is to enable further decentralization of the network through self-regulation by the validators.

1. The update discusses the progress of the Ecosystem Performance API & Dashboard project, which is a key objective in the CU Strategy for 2022. The project aims to provide financial data collection and availability through an API and dashboard, including information from Core Units (CU) and Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAO).

2. The Budget Reporting Tool is highlighted as a crucial component in achieving the first key result: Finance data collection & availability through the API.

3. Parallel to this, the Resilience Improvement Initiative has been launched to focus on decentralized work, which will complement the financial and Core Unit/people information available through the Ecosystem Performance API & Dashboard. The initiative aims to provide an easy-to-understand, transparent view of planning and delivery of work at MakerDAO.

4. Key objectives for the Decentralized Voter Committees, delegates' vision and strategy, KPIs, challenges, opportunities, high-level solutions, strategic and Cross-Core Unit initiatives, and internal Core Unit initiatives with their roadmaps will also be made available through the Ecosystem Performance API & Dashboard.

5. The team encourages feedback and invites interested parties to reach out to @Lenkla regarding the new Budget Reporting Tool. They also invite everyone to join a Status Update call on June 10th at 4:30pm CEST.
Tech company Immunefi has acquired smart contract security firm Klevoya, aiming to expand its services in the field.

Trident Digital Group has proposed a partnership with MakerDAO to facilitate the use of USDP within their ecosystem. The proposal involves paying a marketing fee for continued use of USDP in the PSM and increasing the Max Debt Ceiling to 120mm DAI. This is a revised version of an initial proposal posted on June 30th, aiming for a ceiling increase to 500mm DAI.

Trident Digital Group is a digital asset advisory firm that helps institutions with both on and off-chain solutions. They aim to rebuild market liquidity by connecting borrowers and lenders via their secured non-custodial lending platform, reducing centralized counterparty risk, and assisting various issuers in growing the TVL of their tokens.

Paxos, the USDP issuer, is regulated by the New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS). USDP is fully backed 1:1 by cash and debt instruments guaranteed by the U.S. government or money-market funds composed of such debt instruments. All reserves are segregated from corporate assets and held bankruptcy remote pursuant to the New York Banking Law.

Under the terms of the proposal, Trident will pay a one-time fee and ongoing fixed rates to MakerDAO based on the notional of USDP in the PSM-PAX-A. If approved, this partnership could generate additional annual revenue for MakerDAO and diversify their exposure away from a single stablecoin, reducing potential existential threats to DAI. The contact details for Trident Digital Group are provided for further discussions.

The Compound monthly report for April 2023 was published using an alternative Substack account due to email issues. Analysis of fees and revenue data has been postponed until clarification from DefiLlama regarding discrepancies. In the meantime, a message of "Live long and prosper" was shared.

The text suggests implementing a small fee for creating a proposal, using a virtual currency called "cake." This fee is intended to discourage frivolous proposals and encourage serious ones. If a proposal or part of it is adopted, the creator gets their cake back; otherwise, the cake is "burned" (effectively lost). This system aims to reduce distractions from valuable proposals, prevent duplicate proposals, and ensure that only genuine proposers pay the fee. The cost for making a proposal is set at one unit of cake.

Olympix proposes a collaboration with Aave, offering security tooling for future deployments. The company, a web3 security firm dedicated to developer-first solutions, aims to ensure security as a top priority in DeFi product development.

The proposed tools include:
1. Static Analyzer: Assists developers in finding bugs early using static analysis and protocol knowledge.
2. Unit + Invariant Test Generator: Increases productivity by automating test creation for smart contract code, reducing bias and ensuring comprehensive coverage.

This partnership enhances Aave developers' testing processes, prioritizing security, and strengthening the integrity of their smart contracts. Ongoing communication and support will be maintained to improve tools based on feedback from Aave developers. The invitation is open for discussions regarding tool capabilities and usage.

Title: wGHO Onboarding in Aave V3 Ethereum Pool

Author: Marc Zeller (Aave Chan Initiative, Chaos Labs)

Date: 2023-08-09

Summary: This proposal aims to integrate wGHO, an ERC-20 token wrapper of GHO, as a collateral-only asset in a new stablecoin emode within Aave V3 Ethereum pool. The integration will enable using wGHO as collateral for borrowing stablecoins like USDC, USDT, DAI, and LUSD, facilitating arbitrage and leveraged positions during under-peg GHO situations. This move enhances the Aave ecosystem by providing tools to maintain the GHO peg. wGHO will only be available to borrow DAI, USDC, LUSD & USDT, not for collateral of GHO. The proposal sets specific parameters for the integration and creation of a dedicated stablecoin emode on Aave V3 ETH pool for wGHO, USDC, USDT, DAI, LUSD.

The text discusses the future of the STEP diversification program, a project that aims to diversify Arbitrum's treasury into Real-World Assets (RWAs). The plan is to establish a Steering Committee to guide this initiative and outline Arbitrum's broader RWA strategy. The goal is to allocate at least 1% of ArbitrumDAOâs treasury into RWAs annually for five years.

The Steering Committee will consist of members with backgrounds in RWA Issuers, Treasury Managers, Crypto-Native Funds, Crypto-Native Financial Advisors, Legal Firms, RWA Infrastructure, and individuals with Capital Markets expertise. The committee will identify topics for the next phase (STEP II) and define Arbitrum's overall RWA strategy.

The community is encouraged to participate in bi-weekly meetings and provide feedback. The first meeting is scheduled for August 13th. The formation, composition, and work of the Steering Committee will not be remunerated initially, but a budget may be proposed later based on identified tasks. The RWA Innovation Grants program (RWAIG) is separate from STEP and will align with the Steering Committee's plans once it ends.

dForce plans to introduce a dToken pool (dUSDx/dDAI/dUSDC/dUSDT). dToken is a yield aggregator by dForce, offering high yields in the market (e.g., 12.1% for USDT, 6.1% for USDC and DAI as of Aug 31) through gas optimization strategies. Participants can farm DF tokens via dForce Staking Portal or add a dToken pool on Curve, providing liquidity and earning both DF and CRV tokens, with a combined yield potential of up to 170%. This is an additional incentive for LPs on Curve.

The text discusses a proposal by Bored Brewing to integrate ApeCoin into their beer packaging. This includes creating an ApeCoin-themed beer, QR codes on all cans providing information about the DAO and ApeCoin, and collaborations with other NFT collections. The benefits include marketing ApeCoin to crypto/NFT communities and spreading awareness among non-crypto beer drinkers. The cost is estimated at $175,000 USD, which will be used for ApeCoin educational initiatives, free beer, and a branded beer contest. The proposal is subject to changes for security, usability, and to protect APE holders. The full proposal can be found on the ApeCoin forum.

The document discusses MIP40c3-SP96, a proposal to modify the Data Insights Core Unit Budget (DIN-001). The proposal aims to determine whether assets produced by this unit using funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. Questions include if appropriate licenses will be applied, copyright assigned to the Dai Foundation, and communication channels used for MakerDAO representation. The Anticapture Commission is set to elect a new Lead during Season 5. The Lead must be a non-current Council Lead, draft internal procedures, organize meetings, execute votes, author or coordinate reports, calculate qualifying delegates, decide in case of lack of consensus, and self-nominate by January 2nd. Self-nominations should include delegate commitment link, voting power, participation rate, voting history, contributions to the Optimism ecosystem, relevant experience, potential conflicts, agreement to removal via Representative Removal proposal, and acknowledgement of being a signer on the Commission's multi-signature wallet. The Lead will be elected via simple majority vote between January 4th - January 11th.

The proposed text suggests a decision on the multiplier for the addition of ibBTC/WBTC SLP Setts in the general emission structure. A 1.5x multiplier would maintain current reward levels, while a 2x multiplier would align it with byWBTC Sett long-term rewards. Higher multipliers mean a larger percentage of rewards are reallocated from other non-native Setts to ibBTC SLP Sett. 1. The proposed structure includes committees for various functions such as project applications, appointments, governance, membership, ethics, grants & projects, administrative panel, treasury panel, and technical panel. These committees are elected by the members' assembly or appointed by other committees in an indirect democracy fashion.

2. The structure allows for higher majorities for changes of important matters in the articles of association by the membersâ assembly and/or additional approval by a specific committee for significant decisions such as changing the purpose of the association or liquidation.

3. Committees can create sub-committees, like guilds, which are supervised by the respective committees. For example, the technical committee could introduce sub-committees for each guild.

4. The funding of development companies such as Aragon labs can become subject to a vote by the membersâ assembly (ANT token holders).

5. A formal request will be made to the Aragon Association to adopt the proposed revised articles of association and merge the Aragon Network DAO into the Aragon Association.

6. FAQ addresses questions about the use of a legal entity, potential risks, and reasons for the proposal. The association would provide flexibility in structuring and legal certainty, mitigate the risk of being subject to various jurisdictions worldwide, and protect assets from freezing by authorities under specific circumstances.

7. The IP rights and access credentials to online services would belong to the association and thus indirectly the members as the highest governing body, with ANT holders having the final say in this regard.

8. An AMA session will be held to provide further explanations and address concerns about the proposal.

The latest edition of the Collateral Status Index (CSI) is presented, divided into four sections based on the Collateral Onboarding (COB) process:

1. Collateral Application Status - Includes all collateral applications before prioritization, such as Application, Poll Active, Greenlit, or those withdrawn, postponed, or deferred.
2. Prioritized Collateral - The section for collateral prioritized to move into the Assessment step of the COB process, determined by various factors including MIP6 application completeness and alignment with MakerDAO strategic objectives.
3. Collateral Work In Progress (WIP) - Contains collateral working through the Assessment to Executive Vote statuses, including Assessment, Gov Poll Active, Gov Poll Passed, Implementation, Exec Active, and those not passing governance polls or executive votes.
4. Active Collateral - Includes all collateral applications in Business Review or Active status, recently offboarded, or undergoing offboarding.

The CSI spreadsheet is the primary source of information for collateral moving through the COB process, updated by a limited number of collateral stakeholders to ensure data integrity. If discrepancies are found, they should be reported via the #collateral-engineering-services-public channel on the official MakerDAO Discord server. For specific collateral questions or comments, use the MakerDAO forum within the collateral application forum post. General questions about the CSI update can be posted here.

In this system, burning 100 units of cake results in 50 being instantly lost, while the other 50 is redistributed to previous burnout users. This redistributed cake can be claimed. Investors receive a lifetime investment that continuously produces cake. This process likely generates good returns for users and reduces circulating supply. The numbers given are examples and could vary. Burning more cake is suggested as a long-term strategy to lock it up.

The Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) is assessing its Balancer (BAL) holdings due to their decline. A detailed analysis has been prepared to quantify and budget for available reserves by the end of 2024, considering service provider renewals, additional BAL allocation proposals, and strategic partnerships. The current total BAL holdings across all chains, vaults, and liquidity positions is 4,520,786.

Expected inflows include 242,286 BAL from the termination of Wonderland's collaboration with the Balancer DAO. Expected outflows for the second half of 2024 include service provider expenses and karpatkey fees based on BIP-648.

Planned additional BAL deployments/commitments in 2024 include a CoW<>BAL partnership, a market making strategy to improve CEX liquidity, and several pending proposals on the forum.

After accounting for expected inflows and outflows, an estimated 3,295,929 BAL will remain by the end of the year. However, earmarking $1.25 million worth of BAL for the self-insurance fund will leave approximately 2,689,756 BAL available for future endeavors by the end of 2024. Balancer has deployed BAL on Optimism in collaboration with BeethovenX, aiming to utilize veBAL gauges for BAL emissions. StarkWare is planning to deploy wstETH (Wrapped staked ETH) onto Starknet, aiming for recognition of the wstETH bridge endpoints as canonical by Lido DAO. The deployment aims to boost opportunities within the DeFi ecosystem and increase demand for wstETH across various platforms.

Starknet, an Ethereum scaling solution, has grown significantly over the past year, becoming the 8th largest blockchain developer community among all L2s. Starknet's potential in the DeFi ecosystem is high, creating a significant demand for wstETH.

The current wstETH bridge to Starknet is via StarkGate, with all components being upgradeable. Starkware will enable cross-chain governance, allowing Lido to govern the bridge's wstETH, expected by Q2 2024. The relevant source code and audits will be made available for transparency and accessibility to the Lido community.

As a leading Ethereum scaling solution, Starknet sees high demand for adopting wstETH, opening up opportunities for users to utilize stETH holdings in various DeFi protocols. The recognition of wstETH bridge endpoints as canonical by Lido DAO will enhance the DeFi ecosystem within Starknet and increase the adoption of wstETH.

The community is encouraged to engage in discussions and provide feedback during this development process.

To promote diversity, the Optimism Foundation suggests delegates vote "yes" for their top 1-2 committees per category. For more details, visit the Governance Committees introduction page.

The proposal seeks to include GnosisDAO's treasury in Balancer's VotingEscrow contract, enabling participation in Balancer governance and voting on gauges. GnosisDAO has a partnership with Balancer and has contributed liquidity to the protocol, accumulating 1MM BAL. The proposal lists three Gnosis Safe wallets for this purpose.

B.Protocol has proposed adding a user-based backstop for GHO in Aave to enhance liquidation mechanics and ensure peg stability, especially for less liquid collaterals during market volatility. The backstop will allow users to deposit their GHO into a pool, providing liquidity for smooth liquidations with a fixed slippage. This setup aims to protect Aave from bad debt created by GHO while strengthening GHO stability and potentially earning profits from liquidations.

The backstop is designed to facilitate the liquidation of less liquid collateral assets on Aave V2, reducing the risk of bad debt exposure for the protocol during market downturns. It will also improve the liquidation process for illiquid assets, fostering trust in new stablecoins during severe market conditions.

To incentivize GHO holders to participate in the backstop, B.Protocol suggests allocating $3m as an incentive or setting the backstop as another eligible source for discounted interest rates for GHO. The community will decide on the specific parameters for these incentives.

B.Protocol invites feedback from the Aave community regarding this proposal and its preferred method to incentivize GHO backstoppers. Once approved, B.Protocol will initiate development efforts for the integration.

The text proposes a method for encoding StarkNet transactions into QR codes, enhancing wallet interaction with StarkNet transactions. This method simplifies the transaction signing process, making it more accessible and efficient. Developers can encode transactions using provided methods and generate QR codes. The QR code format includes the transaction type, ID, and parameters. Implementation involves modifying an existing Ethereum-QR-code generator to encode StarkNet transactions as QR codes. This approach ensures backward compatibility with existing StarkNet transactions and provides two library implementation options: a separate qrcode library or integration with existing solutions like ethereum-qR-code. The proposal emphasizes user confirmation, one-time use of QR codes, and minimizing sensitive information in QR codes for security and privacy reasons.

Abdul, leading Business Development for Monad Labs, proposes deploying Balancer on the upcoming high-performance EVM-equivalent blockchain, Monad. The testnet launch is planned for Q2 and mainnet for Q4 this year. Balancer's liquidity bootstrapping pools and advanced AMM features align well with Monad's low fees and high throughput. Deployment on both testnet and mainnet will enhance Balancer's position in the DeFi space. The collaboration aims to bring advanced DeFi capabilities to a growing ecosystem, uniting two vibrant communities. Monad is an EVM-equivalent blockchain built with a focus on performance, introducing optimizations for high throughput (10,000 tps) and preserving full EVM equivalence. It offers seamless compatibility with Ethereum tools and applications, making it an attractive choice for developers and users alike.

Michigan Blockchain is a student-led organization at the University of Michigan focused on blockchain technology since 2019. They offer educational and professional development opportunities, along with project-based experiences. Over six years, they've partnered with over 20 organizations and managed $30M in delegations. Their governance team actively participates in voting and proposal development for Uniswap, Arbitrum, Compound, Origin Protocol, and Stader Labs. By delegating to them, you enable your tokens to contribute to innovation on decentralized exchanges. They aim to set a standard for decentralized community participation, particularly with Uniswap. Their values include fostering an inclusive community, ensuring sustainability, promoting open communication, and prioritizing flexibility. Potential conflicts of interest include their active governance contributions to ARB, COMP, OGN, and SD.

In Q1 2024, the Maker Governance Scope was updated to include two new sections for SparkLend security: (i) SparkLend Freezer Mom and (ii) Multisig Freeze of SparkLend. The SparkLend Freezer Mom contract allows Maker Governance to freeze or pause any markets in SparkLend, with the ability to undo these actions. The Multisig Freeze feature, yet to be defined, will work alongside the SparkLend Freezer Mom, ensuring timely action in emergencies such as potential code exploits.

A proposal has been made by @BA-Labs to introduce the practical details of the SparkLend External Security Access Multisig and recommend its inclusion in the next governance polling cycle. The multisig will enable or disable the GSM delay exception SparkLend Freezer Mom without a governance spell, but Maker Governance can reverse the action via a spell or remove the multisig access if suspected of malicious use.

The multisig at launch would be 2/n, with n being 5, and initial signers consist of two members from Governance Facilitators, BA Labs, and one member from Phoenix Labs, the development team behind SparkLend. Any changes to the signers are subject to a governance poll, except in cases where a signer self-reports loss of access or explicitly expresses their wish to be removed.

The multisig should be used when time is critical and normal governance process would not be sufficient to prevent an issue being exploited, primarily for preventing technical vulnerabilities or unwanted smart contract functionality. The proposal is for the Governance Facilitators to propose a governance poll regarding the activation of the SparkLend External Security Access Multisig.

Title: Community Treasury Board Proposal
   Description: Introduces an independent governance body, the Community Treasury Board (CTB), responsible for managing the Community Treasury in the Polygon ecosystem.
   Author: Mateusz Rzeszowski, Justice Conder, Bojana Tomic, Mihailo Bjelic
   Discussion: Ongoing on the forum
   Status: Continuous
   Type: Informational
   Date: 2024-04-11

The proposal introduces the CTB with responsibilities including creating a strategy for the Community Treasury, approving grants and expenses, and managing a budget. The CTB should comprise experts in ecosystem growth and grant operations who are aligned with Polygon's vision and Web3 values, possess operational expertise, and have community and specific field expertise.

The CTB will set strategies, select tracks for funding, approve expenditures, produce transparency reports, and oversee the flow of funds through on-chain mechanisms. Initial CTB members will receive a monthly payment from the Community Treasury. The proposal also introduces a new governance contract, Governor Bravo, to manage the Community Treasury. Title: Onboarding of weETH to Aave v3 on Ethereum

   The ARFC aims to add Ether.fi's Liquid Restaking Token, weETH, to Aave V3 on Ethereum following successful TEMP CHECK and TEMP CHECK Snapshot. This initiative is intended to diversify assets on Aave and boost liquidity within the ecosystem.

   eETH, an LRT by Ether.fi, allows users to stake their ETH, earn staking rewards, and receive additional rewards through native restaking on EigenLayer. As of February 3rd, approximately $670M in TVL has been deposited into the Ether.fi protocol.

   Risk Parameters for weETH include borrowable, collateral enabled, supply cap, borrow cap, LTV, LT, liquidation bonus, and liquidation protocol fee among others. WeETH is also the first LSP to natively restake on EigenLayer, improving network efficiency and providing stakers with additional rewards.

   If consensus is reached, the proposal will escalate to the Snapshot stage, followed by an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Ether.fi and did not receive compensation for creating this proposal.

Title: Enable AIP Voting During Elections
   Category: Process
   Proposal: This proposal aims to remove the restriction that only approved AIPs can be voted on during the Weekly AIP Release, allowing for voting of ready AIPs at any time during an election period.
   Benefit: The change ensures equality by giving each author the opportunity to have their proposal voted on when ready, without delay due to election season.
   Implementation & Timeline: Upon approval, any AIPs ready for voting during previously restricted periods can be put up for a vote.
   Cost: No ApeCoin is required.

Title: Aave V3 Harmony - Reserve Freeze Proposal

   Status: Proposal

   Author: 3SE Holdings

   Summary: This proposal aims to freeze all reserves in the Aave V3 deployment on Harmony, following the exploit of Harmony's Horizon Bridge. The freezing will protect users by disabling deposits and borrowing while allowing debt repayment, liquidations, withdrawals, and interest rate adjustments. This action does not affect direct transfers to aToken contracts.

   Motivation: The Aave DAO community has reached a consensus to stabilize the Aave V3 Market on Harmony and minimize impact on users, the Protocol, and the DAO due to the Horizon Bridge exploit.

   This initial step will provide flexibility for further action, such as interest rate adjustments or other measures as the situation evolves.

   Specification: If passed, this proposal will instruct the Aave Guardian to use the setReserveFreeze() function on each asset in the Aave V3 Market on Harmony. It will also authorize changes to the IPFS Aave UI and implement additional warnings for users interacting with the Aave V3 Market on Harmony.

The Witnet bot, invited by specific code, queries proposals in the Discord channel. Proposals are initiated via `!proposal` command with a deadline. Once the deadline is reached, the Witnet bot queries random witnesses for the proposal result from the Discord API. Title: Staking System for ApeCoin and Bored Ape Yacht Club Ecosystem

The text proposes an AIP (Ape Improvement Proposal) for a staking system within the ApeCoin and Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC), Mutant Ape Yacht Club (MAYC), and Bored Ape Kennel Club (BAKC) ecosystem. The staking process involves users locking their ApeCoins to earn more tokens based on the duration of the stake, total amount staked, and individual staked amount.

Key features include:
1. Users can stake ApeCoins or commit NFTs (BAYC, MAYC, BAKC) to the staking pool at any point during the period.
2. Accrued ApeCoins can be claimed without affecting the commitment status of an NFT.
3. Committed NFTs remain tradable but cannot be recommitted unless previously uncommitted by the holder.
4. The Foundation's website will be updated to show the staking status of NFTs, and potential buyers will be notified about the commitment status and earned ApeCoins before purchasing.

The estimated timeline for implementation is 12-16 weeks, with an overall cost ranging from $300,000 to $500,000. The proposal requires approval by the Foundation's governance process.

The author, new to the governance ecosystem, proposes an idea for Compound III to become a facilitator for a decentralized stablecoin GHO, recently announced by the Aave Protocol. As a facilitator, Compound III could mint and burn GHO tokens without trust. This proposal aims to remove supply constraints from Compound III, with the only limitation being the bucket size of the facilitator. The borrowing rate paid by GHO borrowers would go to the Compound DAO/Treasury. The author suggests this could benefit Compound III and its community by supporting a fully decentralized stablecoin's growth, potentially increasing revenue for the DAO. The author also mentions the possibility of Compound III becoming a base vault for DAI, but this would require a new primitive. The author encourages early discussion on this topic as GHO is not yet live.
The text does not provide information on whether the OUTOCAKE APR has been increased or not.

This text discusses a proposal to increase the capFactor of AMPL (Ampleforth) from cap1 to cap2, raising its limit from $1M to $3M. The current AMPL liquidity is approximately $3.4M. Ampleforth has developed a Smart Pool that updates weights daily with supply changes to minimize impermanent loss for LPs on other decentralized exchange platforms. An AMPL/USDC pool with $6.5M of liquidity exists due to this smart pool. AMPL is a digital currency with an elastic supply that adjusts daily based on market demand, aiming to shift volatility from price to supply. The supply can change significantly over time while maintaining a price within the 2019 US Dollar's band.

StarSwap is a unique DEX that incorporates NFT governance, addressing the utility issue in the NFT space. It will offer standard DEX features along with speed and low transaction fees provided by Astar Network.

StarCards, an NFT platform feature, allows regular community members to govern the DEX and earn trading fees. All trading fees will be distributed among StarCards holders. Additionally, StarSwap aims to provide other NFT projects on Astar Network with a use case for their collectors.

StarSwap introduces an NFT staking feature that allows NFT projects to apply for inclusion and lets the community vote on whether to include them. This gives the community control over the DEX's operation. StarCards is a collection of 3000 NFTs launching in three phases, with the first phase starting on May 5th, 2022.

StarTokens, the native token of StarSwap, will have a fair launch and community-driven liquidity generation event after the StarCards launch. The platform's roadmap includes several development phases, with the beta launch of StarSwap DEX expected at the end of May.

The tokenomics reserve 90% of Star tokens for community rewards, 5% for the team, 1% for LGE, 2% for early investor support, and 1% each for NFT staking and PR & Marketing. The goal is to bring inclusiveness to DeFi by providing a smooth platform in the Astar Network to grow the entire ecosystem. Further details can be found on Twitter (@AstarSwap) and the project's documentation (docs.starswap.net).

Bored Trading Co (BTC) is a community-driven initiative founded by over 400+ MBAs to address challenges in scaling IP products. Key issues include poor visibility, limited resources, distribution challenges, and payments barriers. The company aims to create a consumer flywheel, focusing on event participation, curated product bundles, community engagement, and IP collaboration. They plan to expand to various communities like Pudgies, Mocaverse, 10KT, Azuki, etc., and leverage e-commerce to drive utility for ApeCoin. BTC aims to maintain contact with consumers on Instagram and TikTok, having been selected as a winner in ThankApe's BBAC Accelerator program. They will build infrastructure to support the long tail of businesses and collaborate closely with ThankApe to benefit the ApeCoin ecosystem.

Title: Purpose and Guidelines for Polygon Funding Proposals (PFP)

Description: A framework for the governance of the Community Treasury, an independent fund for the development and growth of the Polygon ecosystem, is described. Anyone can submit a PFP to propose changes to the Treasury's governance processes. The main discussion space for all PFPs is the Polygon Community Forum.

Author: Mateusz Rzeszowski, Justice Conder, Bojana Tomic, Mihailo Bjelic

Discussion: Ongoing

Status: Continuous (Informational)

Type: Informational Document

Date: 2024-04-11

A PFP is a formal proposal to change the Community Treasury's governance processes. Two types of PFPs are distinguished: informational and Treasury Board proposals. The flow of a PFP includes five possible states: Proposed, Review, Accepted, Rejected, and Archived. A PFP should contain a title, status, abstract, specification, and may be edited by designated PFP editors. All copyrights for this work are waived under CC0 1.0 Universal.

Title: Introduction to Afloat - On-chain 3D Production and Distribution Platform

Afloat is a platform designed to revolutionize the entertainment industry, addressing issues such as low compensation for 3D artists, lack of credit, and competitive bidding leading to studio bankruptcy. The platform aims to create a sustainable ecosystem for 3D artists by managing ownership, monetization, and creation of 3D assets and projects.

The Afloat Network is built using Substrate WASM, Astar zkEVM, Rust, Ink, zkEVM, XVM, and IPFS. It bridges to various ecosystems and leverages emerging technologies like PolkaVM and JAM for decentralized computation and Metaverse integration.

The platform application is built with Swift, supporting PixarUSD, Hydra, and MaterialX libraries. The user interface caters to the roles of Creator, Project, and Collector, offering advanced features for creators and simple features for collectors.

The team consists of three founders and six advisors, bringing expertise in 3D generalist, software engineering, PixarUSD pipelines, strategic partnerships, legal complexities, technical knowledge, business direction, and research.

Afloat's short-term goal is to release the first version of the platform and network, build the community, secure partnerships, and launch the token for continuous development. The long-term aim is to transition into a DAO for 3D production and distribution in the Metaverse, with the community deciding the direction of Afloat.

The team has already brought PixarUSD into the Swift programming language, SwiftUSD, and developed afloat.app and afloat.network. They are actively raising funds for further development. All staking rewards will go towards the platform's development, eventually covering creators' publishing costs.

The Afloat Platform provides on-chain 3D production and distribution, aiming to bring original 3D production assets from projects like Star Wars to the audience.

The governance of H2O Data is currently managed by $PSDN & $vlPSDN tokens. The psdnOCEAN/OCEAN pool serves as the primary source of liquidity for OCEAN's liquid staking token, contributing to the Balancer Community. The owner of the pool is set to a Zero address. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 and add the gauge to the pool.

Title: 0x Protocol's Governance Portal Development by Boardroom

   Project Overview: Boardroom is developing a governance portal for 0x Protocol, enhancing its governance with a new Governance Client and a developer toolkit. The project aims to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of 0x Protocol governance, focusing on increasing distribution and delegator access.

   Key Personnel: Kevin Nielsen (Point of Contact) - Twitter: @kevinknielsen | Email: hello@boardroom.info | Discord: kevinknielsen | Boardroom.io#7885

   Funding Details: $17.5k grant, primarily used for engineering and development costs. The grant will cover initial integration and ongoing maintenance and support.

   Project Deliverables:
      - Governance Client: A hosted portal that supports standard 0x Protocol governance contracts and custom aspects.
      - Developer Toolkit: Allows developers to integrate any non-standard aspects of the governance contracts.

   Timeline: Approximately 8-12 weeks for integration, staging, client custom functionality, testing, and feedback before release.

   Engagement with the 0x Community: Boardroom seeks feedback from active governance participants on desired features and improvements for the application.

   Benefits to the 0x Protocol Ecosystem: The full-stack governance solution provided by Boardroom will make 0x Protocol governance more efficient and effective, particularly focusing on increasing distribution and delegator access to governance.

Title: Integration of FRAX Stablecoin on Aave V3 Markets (Polygon, Fantom, and Avalanche)

FRAX is a stablecoin that combines algorithmic and collateralized mechanisms to maintain its price target. It ranks 7th in market cap (2.7B) among stablecoins. FRAX has never deviated more than 1 cent from its peg since its launch 15 months ago.

FRAX is the largest Curve pool on Ethereum mainnet with nearly $3B in liquidity and is a top 10 token on Uniswap. It has been successfully lent out on Aave v2 for many months without any issues. FRAX is already deployed natively on Polygon, Fantom, and Avalanche where Aave V3 operates.

In the Aave ecosystem, FRAX will serve as a borrowable stablecoin alternative to existing options. It has potential to increase Aave & FRAX volume while contributing to FRAX's stability. FRAX can also utilize its Lending AMO to mint protocol-controlled FRAX for lending on Aave markets.

FRAX is permissionless and is currently being used in deep liquidity pools across various stableswap+AMM protocols. It does not have a governance token emission schedule. There is a multisig for certain AMO contracts but it cannot alter user balances or protocol behavior. FRAX has undergone two thorough audits.

The token was launched on December 20th, 2020, and has over 25,000 cross-chain token holders. It is deployed across multiple chains, making it the most cross-chain native stablecoin on the market.

SUSHI TOP is collaborating with Zatsudan for its first anniversary, planning to distribute NFTs. Zatsudan is an audio content delivery service initiated by Takafumi Horie, a notable figure in the Japanese business world who founded Livedoor, Inc.

Sushi Top has been distributing various NFTs on Shiden but will now do so on Astar for Zatsudan. This subcategory is designed for professional journalists, writers, bloggers, and other media representatives to communicate with MakerDAO regarding media inquiries. To post threads, one must be part of the @Media group, which can be requested from @Davidutro. The subcategory allows for general media inquiries, informational requests, information verification requests, and request for comments by specific individuals. It has special permissions, with only members of the Media Group able to post threads and Trust Level 3 users (including Mandated Actors, Core Unit Facilitators, Recognized Delegates, select Core Unit employees/contributors, and senior community members) able to reply to threads. Topics should avoid vague questions, hypothetical unrelated questions, repeat questions, off-topic questions, unfair or loaded questions, and inappropriate personal questions. Comments made by MakerDAO members represent their individual views and not necessarily the views of MakerDAO as a whole.

The text provided outlines a set of Maker Improvement Proposals (MIPs) that are being proposed to support the Endgame, which is likely a term referring to the final stage of the MakerDAO system. These MIPs cover various aspects of the Maker ecosystem, including stability and liquidity, decentralized collateral, real-world asset collateral, the Maker Ecosystem, Protocol Engineering, Growth, Physical Resilience, Interfaces, Infrastructure, Finance, Arbitration, Governance security, and more.

The latest proposals in RFC (Request for Comments) that are eligible for the April Governance Cycle include MIP55c3-SP17, MIP115, MIP117, MIP118, MIP119, and MIP120. These proposals have varying impacts on the system, ranging from medium to high.

For any questions or assistance related to MIPs, users are encouraged to reach out to @blimpa or @Gala. Additionally, pre-MIP discussions are ongoing regarding topics such as a BFF partnership with GnosisDAO, increasing MIP efficiency through community polls, anti-inflationary proposals, auction-backed DAI, IAM for Surplus Buffer, and proposal ideas on the forum.

The text discusses a proposal to integrate Formula Market Makers (FMMs) with 0x, a decentralized exchange protocol. Unlike existing DEX types such as AMMs and order books, FMMs are hybrid mechanisms consisting of both on-chain and off-chain components. They operate according to a publicly available formula, ensuring constant availability and integration within the DEX ecosystem. Liquidity provision in FMMs is similar to AMMs, making it easy and accessible for all. The text suggests that Clipper, an early example of an FMM, has been able to avoid significant loss due to its unique market maker structure, combining qualities of both AMMs and PMMs. The author believes FMMs will grow in popularity within DeFi and proposes a standard integration with 0x for easier addition. Key benefits of FMMs include non-discriminatory pricing, ease of liquidity provisioning, faster price updates to reduce arbitrage loss, and composability.

The text discusses the recommendations for launching an eBTC protocol with uncorrelated and correlated pairs, using a 77% Liquidation Loss Tolerance Value (LLTV) for uncorrelated pairs and an 86% LLTV for correlated pairs.

The document also addresses potential risks such as griefing attacks on CDP users and stETH price divergence. The authors believe that the risk of griefing attacks is mitigated due to the high cost of execution and limited impact on end-users. As for stETH price divergence, they suggest that it's less likely to occur during redemption activity because of buying pressure from liquidations or users reducing leverage.

The authors propose the following parameter recommendations:
- Redemption Fee Floor: 2.5%
- Redemption Fee Alpha (Î±): 0.05
- Redemption Fee Decay Factor (Î´): 0.5

They also recommend leaving the existing below peg protocol-owned liquidity unchanged, which will allow for efficient liquidations even if liquidator bot operators have not directly integrated eBTC redemptions as a liquidity source. Over time, the below peg ranges may be tightened based on observed liquidator bot behaviors, integration of redemptions into DEX aggregators, and observed eBTC peg conditions.

References are provided for further reading on Morpho LIF per LLTV, eBTC protocol parameters, and a Badger Finance paper on the eBTC protocol.

Random Sampling is a statistical method used to draw conclusions about a population by selecting participants with equal probability. It's beneficial in situations where information from the entire population is costly or impractical. In the context discussed, it's being considered for use in the Citizens' House, a democratic structure aiming for even power distribution among citizens. The goal is to reduce the concentration of power and avoid capture by a small subset or minority interest. Random sampling doesn't assume all citizens are interchangeable; instead, it reduces bias associated with other selection methods. It's being experimented with to scale participation without overburdening individual citizens.

The proposal aims to establish clear guidelines for community approval in multisig transactions. It suggests a minimum voting period of 3 days and sets three tiers of quorum and majority vote requirements:

1. A 1% quorum requiring a 75% majority vote,
2. A 4% quorum requiring a 60% majority vote,
3. A 6% quorum requiring a simple 51% majority vote.

These requirements are designed to prevent manipulation by whales or quick votes and ensure that the community's decision is representative. The proposal also allows for votes to pass with low voter turnout if they are popular, recognizing the difficulty in motivating users for governance.

The benefits include clear rules for signers, accountability, prevention of single-whale or colluding whale manipulation, and a system that doesn't penalize popular decisions with low voter turnout. Potential drawbacks could be the denial of votes on small issues due to difficulty in achieving larger voter turnout and the complexity of tracking different percentage thresholds at different levels.

The Aave Chan Initiative (ACI) has proposed updates to the Merit program for Round 6, aiming to enhance efficiency and align with recent developments. Key changes include:

1. Removal of weETH from the "Diversity supporter" LST boost and OG DAO participant Booster to promote equality among users.
2. Introduction of a new "Eth Maxi" Boost for wETH suppliers, incentivizing them on Ethereum, Arbitrum, and Aave Lido markets.
3. Implementation of the Ahab program for wETH suppliers in the Aave Lido Instance to initiate a Liquidity Mining Program.
4. Potential expansion of Merit rewards for StkGHO to Arbitrum Safety Module if approved by governance.
5. Activation of ACI as Emission manager for wETH on Mainnet, Arbitrum, and the Aave Lido market if approved by governance.

The proposal requires community consensus, followed by a Snapshot vote for formal approval. If approved, these changes will be implemented in Merit Round 6. The Aave Chan Initiative proposes these updates independently without external compensation.

The Maker Oracle network is a permissionless system where anyone can read and relay messages, but only authorized signers (Oracle Feeders) have their messages relayed. This includes 14 Anon feeders (dark feeds) selected in 2017 and 11 Public feeders from established crypto projects.

Collusion among feeders could allow them to steal DAI by signing attestations for fake L2 withdrawals. Mitigation strategies include keeping the quorum high and the debt ceiling low, and public feeds risking their reputation and legal risks if they participate in collusion.

Censorship, Availability, Software Vulnerability, Private Key, and RPC Node Attack are other identified risks with corresponding mitigation strategies. The Oracle Core Unit has implemented measures to address these risks, but the community is advised to be aware of the inherent risks when adjusting the signer quorum and the Teleport debt ceiling.

For more detailed information, resources include "Introducing Maker Wormhole", a detailed design, Leeloo Readme, and Lair Readme. The Maker Oracle network is designed to minimize these risks while allowing for efficient and secure operation.

In Decentralized Finance (DeFi), loans are overcollateralized, requiring more value of one asset to be pledged as collateral than the borrowed amount. This ensures loan repayment. If the value of your collateral decreases or the loan's value increases, it may lead to liquidation. To prevent this, maintaining sufficient collateral is crucial. If necessary, additional assets can be deposited into the protocol for collateral use. Tools like HAL and DeFi Saver help monitor and manage loan positions, with HAL providing notifications about Health Factor (HF) and DeFi Saver facilitating automatic loan liquidation when needed. Maintaining a Health Factor above 1 is essential to avoid liquidation.

Title: BoLD Upgrade for Arbitrum One and Nova

### Technical Risks
- Potential issues preventing liveness of challenges due to smart contract bugs in new contracts.
- Safety risks where a malicious party can game the system and win due to logic errors in smart contracts.
- Logic bugs in assertion smart contracts affecting assertion confirmation and posting, potentially delaying withdrawals.
- Bugs in bonding logic in smart contracts that could lead to loss of funds.
- No change in bugs related to one step proof logic for Arbitrum chains.

### Timeline and Steps to Implement BoLD
1. Deployment of a public testnet with BoLD validators for 4 weeks.
2. Submission of the AIP as a forum post.
3. Audit of the protocolâs implementation by Trail of Bits.
4. Governance calls to discuss BoLD and this AIP.
5. Formal temperature check proposal to activate BoLD on Arbitrumâs Sepolia for 4 weeks via Snapshot vote.
6. Public audit program.
7. Finalize pre-mainnet requirements, including documentation, monitoring stack, and L1 gas costs reimbursement procedure.
8. Formal AIP submission to Tally.
9. If the formal on-chain proposal passes, BoLD will activate on Arbitrum One and Nova.

### Overall Cost
No cost for the ArbitrumDAO as Offchain Labs, Inc. will cover engineering and audit costs. Future development work for BoLD is expected to be undertaken by Offchain Labs, Inc.

### Disclaimer
Pending withdrawals when the proposed BoLD upgrade is activated will be delayed until the first BoLD assertion is confirmed. This means that all pending withdrawals initiated before the upgrade will be delayed by 1 challenge period, plus the time between the withdrawal was initiated and the time that the BoLD upgrade takes place.

### FAQ
For additional topics & questions, please visit the BoLD specific FAQ document [here](https://www.notion.so/arbitrumfoundation/Arbitrum-BoLD-FAQ-93210f430a6a470792496be040ac9990).

On December 10th, 2023, a shortfall of approximately $274,000 occurred in the Venus Liquid Staked BNB pool. This was due to an issue with the SnBNB Oracle, causing its price inflation to $77 billion. An exploiter used a small position of ~0.5 SnBNB to deplete the assets available in the pool. The incident affected only the funds in the LST Isolated pool, with no user funds in other pools compromised.

The timeline shows the exploiter funded their wallet, swapped BNB to Sn BNB, supplied SnBNB on Venus, borrowed various assets from the pool, and depleted its liquidity. The impact assessment reveals that the exploiter borrowed a total of $274,000 worth of assets from the pool.

Since the incident, Chaos Labs has been monitoring the protocol closely, confirming no unusual activity in other pools. Collaboration with Venus and Binance teams is ongoing to assess potential impact on other assets, particularly those relying on the Binance Oracle.

As a precautionary measure, operations involving certain assets have been temporarily suspended until the investigation into the Oracle malfunction is complete, and any necessary corrective actions are implemented. The affected markets include stkBNB, SnBNB (LST pool), and agEUR (Stablecoin pool).

In this scenario, the `stakingBoost` is calculated to increase the adjusted liquidity in a Balancer Pool by a desired amount, while excluding shareholder addresses from participating in liquidity staking.

1. First, calculate the `liquidityPreStaking`, which is the total adjusted liquidity from applying all factors but with `stakingBoost = 1`. In this example, let's say the result was $200M.

2. Calculate the final desired liquidity by using the formula: `finalLiquidity = liquidityPreStaking / (1 - STAKERS_SHARE)`. For instance, if the share of stakers is 45000/145000, then the final liquidity would be $290M.

3. Apply a temporary `tempStakingBoost > 1` to `{BAL & uncapped_token}` pairs from non-shareholder LPs, resulting in a `tempLiquidity`. Let's say our result was $230M. This would mean the `tempStakingBoost` increased the adjusted liquidity in $30M, while what we actually want is an increase of $90M.

4. To get the desired `stakingBoost`, stretch or shrink the `tempStakingBoost` according to the ratio between the two liquidity adjustments (desired & temporary):

   ```(finalLiquidity - liquidityPreStaking) / (tempLiquidity - liquidityPreStaking) = stakingBoost / tempStakingBoost```

5. In this example, the `stakingBoost` would be 3 times the `tempStakingBoost`.

6. Shareholder addresses associated with Balancer Labs (investors, advisors, and founders) will be excluded from liquidity staking to accelerate governance rights distribution. The list of these shareholder addresses can be found [here](https://github.com/balancer-labs/bal-mining-scripts/blob/liquidity-staking/src/users.ts).

7. The community is willing to tolerate up to about 10k BAL per week per shareholder being sent to centralized exchanges, and any changes to the list of excluded addresses can be made by the community as needed.

DAOhaus is a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) that focuses on facilitating its ecosystem through grants, utilization of $HAUS as a coordination mechanism, and supporting the utility and value of contributor compensation denominated in $HAUS.

Key aspects of DAOhaus governance include:
- Grants denominated in $HAUS to increase the relative stability of the $HAUS price.
- Utilizing $HAUS as a coordination mechanism within the DAOhaus ecosystem, beyond just voting.
- Supporting the utility and value of contributor compensation denominated in $HAUS.

The platform does not rely on external oracles, and the most used smart contracts are instances of the MolochV2.1 contract framework, which was audited by ConsenSys Diligence. The contracts used within the DAOhaus platform are not upgradable.

DAOhaus takes decentralization seriously, with none of its contracts being upgradable and governance power over key on-chain assets distributed across multiple entities. However, the largest centralization vector is front-end hosting, which a handful of developers have admin control over. The goal is to migrate the entire stack to decentralized infrastructure.

In the last 24 hours, a vulnerability affecting an active Node Operator using the Lido on Ethereum protocol (InfStones) was disclosed by security researchers dWallet Labs in July 2023. The vulnerability potentially exposed root-level access to 25 validator servers, possibly including key material, to external attackers. It's unclear if Lido validators were affected. Lido DAO contributors are collaborating with the Node Operator to investigate the incident and understand its implications. Further details will be shared soon.

There are questions about the feasibility and potential benefits of this move, with no similar efforts mentioned apart from Arachain. Interested parties are invited to collaborate.

The text proposes a new feature for predictions, allowing users to bet on higher odds with a minimum payout of 2.1x. Any excess funds will be refunded. This feature aims to increase user engagement by offering an additional betting option, providing a more balanced win multiplier, and enabling larger bets without significantly reducing the size of potential winnings due to unbalanced betting. The suggested limits may need to be applied per account.
