In the game referred to as Cake Burnout, 100 units of cake are initially available. When 50 units are burned, another 50 are redistributed to previous burnout users. This process continues indefinitely, with investors receiving a lifetime investment that continually produces cake. The numbers given are examples and can vary. Burning more cake is suggested as a long-term strategy.

The text presents a proposal by DFX Finance to add gauges for two pools, DFX/ETH 50/50 and DFX/TEL/USDC 40/40/20, on the Balancer ecosystem. DFX Finance is a decentralized foreign exchange protocol facilitating stablecoin swaps with low volatility. The proposal aims to incentivize liquidity migration and increase trading volumes on Balancer.

DFX tokens serve as governance for the protocol, with holders voting on proposals through Snapshot. The DFX token does not rely on external oracles; it uses Chainlink for real-world forex price feeds. Multiple audits have been conducted on DFX smart contracts by Trail of Bits, Haechi, and Zellic.

The oldest DFX pool on Balancer is 230 days old with a daily volume of $4M, and there is currently $420,000 worth of DFX liquidity on Balancer. The proposal does not specify any streamer or root gauge for the gauges to be added.
A proposal by Cattin - Seed Latam requests 125,000 ARB in the STIP round. The reasoning behind this request is detailed in an addendum available on the Arbitrum forum.

The text discusses a web app and dashboard project, led by Corbin Page, aimed at visualizing the Balancer community. The dashboard will present metrics on $BAL holders and their activities (holding, trading, LPing, governance votes). It aims to bring transparency to the community, which is currently scattered across various platforms.

The project will be open-source under MIT license and will provide features like self-identification, viewing LP rewards, top pool creators, voting, and more from January 2021. The MVP (Minimum Viable Product) release is scheduled for September 2020. The project's GitHub can be found at https://github.com/corbinpage. Corbin Page has a background in running Yield Farmersâ Almanac, managing @DeFiWhale, and serving as the Head of Product at ConsenSys Codefi, co-founding Meridio.

Cycle 21 of the governance process commences on March 28th and concludes on April 17th. Voting for approved proposals begins on April 11th at 19:00 GMT, with voting taking place at https://vote.optimism.io/. The Citizensâ House will have a one-week veto period following the Token House Voting Period. The Arbitrum Multi-sig Support Service (MSS) is seeking applications from qualified individuals or organizations for 12 elected positions. These roles will involve managing DAO-funded multi-sigs, with a base compensation of USD amount in ARB. There are three chairs, compensated $2500/month, and nine signers receiving $1500 per month. Each member serves a 12-month term.

Applicants must possess a dedicated hardware wallet for this election, be funded with sufficient ether for transaction fees, and provide personal information, professional background, technical skills, conflict of interest declaration, motivation, and references. The application window closes on June 19th.

The father is selling everything and reaching out to people in their city for donations. Every small donation can make a significant difference.

The proposal suggests implementing a lottery system for chefs, where users can stake their 'cake' tokens to win the lottery. The annual percentage rate (Apr) could be 75% of that offered by manual staking. The remaining rewards would be used to burn 'cake'. This approach offers an alternative method for burning 'cake', encourages more people to hold 'cake' and potentially boost demand, and provides a chance for small stakeholders to win big.

PancakeSwap has introduced a new Syrup Pool for Step Hero, an NFT fantasy-themed RPG game on Binance Smart Chain and Polygon. The pool allows users to stake CAKE tokens to earn HERO tokens.

The total tokens in the pool are 320,000 HERO, with distribution lasting 60 days, starting from approximately 9am UTC on September 6th and ending on November 5th. The rewards per block are 0.1851 HERO. For the first 48 hours, there is a 100 CAKE token cap staking limit per user.

Step Hero is an ecosystem combining NFT gaming and DeFi, offering a fantasy-themed RPG game, NFT marketplace, collectibles, and HERO token. It aims to provide a social network experience with a supportive community. For more information, visit Step Hero's official communication channels.

To stake CAKE for HERO rewards, users should visit the PancakeSwap Syrup Pool webpage, approve CAKE, click 'stake', and confirm the transaction. BEP20 HERO will be circulating and tradeable on PancakeSwap during the pool period. Users are warned to only use the official HERO token contract address to avoid scams.

The text discusses a proposal for improving the Tier system in dApp Staking v3. The current system, while fair, creates an unfairness as rewards do not increase if the threshold is not exceeded significantly. A hybrid model combining dynamic and fixed rewards is proposed to address this issue. In the hybrid model, rewards will gradually increase within each tier until the maximum limit is reached, reducing drastic loss for minor shortfalls. However, the proposal may be more complex than the current reward logic, potentially increasing the burden on the blockchain. A compromise solution involves increasing the number of tiers significantly but not fundamentally solving the problem. Developers' input is needed to address this concern.

This forum discussion proposes a reduction in liquidation bonus for eleven Aave V2 assets: WBTC, REN, BAT, YFI, MKR, ZRX, CRV, XSUSHI, AAVE, MANA, and SNX. The proposal is an extension of previous updates and follows AIP-34: Liquidation Bonus Updates. Since the launch of Aave V2, no risk parameter values have been updated. The liquidation bonus changes, implemented on September 4, 2021, saved around $100k USD for users, with no additional insolvencies recorded after a one-day drop in ETH price. The recommended new liquidation bonuses are listed in the table provided. If needed, model inputs can be supplied upon request. The next steps include initiating a Snapshot immediately and targeting an AIP on September 20, 2021.

The proposal discusses extending the govFactor, a voting incentive for the Balancer Protocol, indefinitely for version 1 (V1) liquidity mining. The govFactor was initially introduced as a trial to boost voter participation and has been successful, increasing tokenholder participation significantly. However, with the transition to V2, there will be no factors implemented in V2 liquidity mining. This proposal aims to decide whether or not the Balancer protocol should continue using the govFactor in V1 liquidity mining. The govFactor is a 1.1x factor applied to the adjusted liquidity of V1 LPs who voted on the most recent Snapshot proposal(s). For more details, refer to the original Snapshot proposal.

The Scroll team proposes that the Uniswap DAO recognizes their upcoming mainnet deployment of Uniswap V3 as the official deployment. This deployment is on Scroll, a zk-rollup solution for Ethereum, and has already been tested with over 1.8M transactions on their testnet. The proposal aims to integrate Scroll into Uniswap's user interface, fostering L2 native innovation and capturing the zkEVM market.

Benefits include increased TVL and order volume for Uniswap, listing of new assets unique to Scroll, and access to a growing developer community. The deployment is secure with a trustless Layer 1 <> Layer 2 bridge and reliance on cryptography rather than unreliable crypto-economics.

The full deployment is expected to take a few hours, subject to Ethereum Layer 1 Uniswap Protocol governance. The approval of this proposal will lead to the canonical Uniswap V3 contracts being deployed on Scroll and amending the uniswap.eth ENS subdomain to reference the Uniswap v3 Factory contract on Scroll. The timeline for this proposal includes a request for comment in July 2023, followed by a temperature check, contract deployment, bridge deployment, and governance proposal in September 2023.

The TechOps Core Unit continues to support critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability with a 24/7 schedule. In January 2023, they handled 102 incidents across various services including AWS infrastructure, EC2, Nodes, Analytics dashboard, and Forum. Internal Community tickets created using the designated channel totaled 20 in January. Various teams within TechOps are working on tasks such as whitelisting executive spells, updating Chief keeper, and investigating VDB P1 alerts. Every last Friday of the month at 14:30 UTC, TechOps hosts open office hours for the Maker Community.

Curve Finance is planning to use the community fund for grants focused on ecosystem, DAO, and community development. The goal is to encourage and foster the Curve ecosystem and empower the community. Title: Launch Apekin Coin on ApeChain Proposal

   The proposal aims to launch Apekin Coin, a new community coin within the ApeCoin ecosystem, using the Ape Express platform. The initiative will engage the ApeCoin community, support the ApeChain ecosystem, and create innovative opportunities for builders and users.

   Key objectives include fostering community involvement through competitions and giveaways, creating an inaugural ApeChain NFT, developing a fun interactive game, and retaining a portion of the total Apekin Coin supply for further ecosystem enhancement.

   The airdrop will target active ApeCoin community members, Yuga Assets, and Mocaverse NFT holders on ApeChain. The use of requested funding covers technical implementation costs, marketing efforts, legal and operational costs, initial community-building activities, game development, and future initiatives.

   The proposal benefits the ApeCoin ecosystem by increasing community engagement, adding value for holders, showcasing the capabilities of the Ape Express platform, establishing Apekin Coin as a community coin, and introducing an interactive game.

   The requested funding is 100,000 ApeCoins, with 6.9% reserved for future development and community initiatives. A 30% gross revenue share will be given to the ApeCoin DAO from all revenue streams associated with Apekin Coin.

The text discusses the distribution and movement of Dai, a stablecoin, across various blockchain networks including Avalanche, Binance Smart Chain, Fantom, Polygon, and Layer-2 solutions like Arbitrum, Aztec, Optimism, and Loopring.

Avalanche saw an increase in Dai with more users opting for this network, while Binance Smart Chain experienced a decrease. Fantom showed growth as well. On Polygon, the focus is on scaling solutions with Curve, Sushiswap, Abracadabra showing significant TVL (Total Value Locked).

Arbitrum and Aztec are highlighted for their privacy features and potential growth. Optimism has had some growing pains but still holds around 28.8 million Dai. Loopring is in the prototype phase, while zkSync has attracted more Dai than its competitors with over 3.2 million bridged to the L2.

The text concludes by inviting readers to share suggestions for improving these breakdowns and emphasizing the importance of doing one's own research before investing or using DeFi products and services.

The Starknet JS stack is being updated with a new Wallet<>Dapp API, decoupling dependencies between wallets, dapps and starknet.js versions. This update simplifies communication between wallets and dapps, and supports methods for account address information, transaction sending, and signing SNIP-12 typed data. The new API creates a clear separation of concerns between the Dapp, the wallet, and the provider. New repositories and packages have been released to facilitate transition to the new API. This change will become the standard by Starknet mainnet update around September 2024. During the transition period, both API versions will be supported. Dapp developers are encouraged to try out the new stack with the new versions of Starknet-js, starknet-react, and get-starknet. Users should not experience any issues during this change.

The proposal aims to increase the DEFI+L capTier from `cap1` to `cap2`, raising it from $1M to $3M. This adjustment is due to the total adjusted liquidity of DEFI+L surpassing $3M, exceeding the current imposed cap. The purpose is to distribute a more equitable share of BAL tokens to DEFI+L pools via liquidity mining. DEFI+L is a popular and liquid pie from PieDAO, a creator of tokenized ETFs, which actively rebalances and represents DeFi's biggest and best assets.

REB2, a community-forked version of the AMPL project, offers a fair and transparent alternative with unique features such as immutable smart contracts, a publicly callable rebase mechanism, a decentralized Oracle, fair distribution, and rebases every 12 hours. To protect against arbitrage attacks, REB2 was forked into REB2 and launched on Uniswap a month ago, and has now been released on SushiSwap. The current supply of REB2 is approximately 2 million, with a market capitalization of around 470k. An LP incentive program has been initiated on SushiSwap, offering high APR rewards to liquidity providers. REB2 aims to secure a spot on the SushiSwap menu for increased liquidity and yield farming opportunities. For more information or questions, join their Telegram group or contact them on Discord.

100k bounty proposed for two researchers, flashfish0x and nipun_pit, in relation to xSUSHI's incident analysis. The Aave community is asked for approval to release these funds. Payment coordination will be handled by eboado (Aave governance forum) and the Aave Grants DAO. Funds will come from the last allocation.

The text discusses a proposal to build an ecosystem for GameFi NFT-based Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs) and vaults using ApeCoin. This ecosystem aims to enhance user engagement in game communities by creating gamified DAOs that allow active wallets to participate. Inactive assets will be pooled into a community vault and redistributed among members.

The proposed system increases NFT scarcity and price, attracting more buyers and investment in the ApeCoin-driven DAO community. It offers incentives to participating voters, fostering engagement. Each game community will have its own DAO with defined governance rules. Only APE coinholders can create and engage in these game DAOs and vaults.

The proposal requires $520k denominated in APE coins and offers 2m STZ tokens as partnership value to the ApeDAO, equivalent to 2.02% of the token's total supply. The full proposal can be found at the provided link. The implementation is administered by the Ape Foundation, with potential alterations to optimize security and usability.

This proposal, found on Balancer's forum, is a Treasury swap between Balancer DAO and Fei Protocol. Fei Protocol, a core contributor at the stablecoin Fei v2, aims to manage volatility risk through Balancer v2 platform, potentially adding $913M+ of current PCV (Protocol Controlled Value) to Balancer.

The proposal suggests exchanging 200,000 BAL for an equivalent USD value of TRIBE and FEI from Fei DAO Treasury. The swap would diversify the treasuries into two assets: FEI, a stable asset, and TRIBE, offering governance rights and Protocol Controlled Value performance upside.

Benefits include treasury diversification, eligibility for Balancer to earn additional TRIBE through Fei's incentivized staking programs, adding stable assets to Balancer Treasury, distributing tokens to a long-term ecosystem partner, and granting governance power for DAO proposals.

The swap will use the 20 day smooth moving average price at the time voting ends, with the price feed being BAL/USDT (Binance) and TRIBE/FEI (Uni-V2) FEI/ETH (Uni-V2). Both parties commit to holding their respective tokens for the long run.

The onboarding process for the Bolt protocol involves two main steps: Off-chain Validator signature Authentication and Opt-in Procedure.

1. Off-chain Validator signature Authentication: Validators need a signature to validate preconfirmation requests. This will be achieved through various signing methods, such as the Commit Boost signing manager. Proposers, along with their key managers, will interact with a commit-boostâs signing manager and proxy key scheme to authorize respective validators and authenticate commitments.

2. Opt-in Procedure: Once registered, proposers must post some form of collateral to guarantee economic credibility behind their preconfirmations. The specific method for achieving this is yet to be determined.

Bolt is currently seeking validators for Cohort 1 for testing and demonstrating the protocol. Lido node operators are ideal partners for this purpose.

For on-chain registration, proposers would sign a message with their withdrawal address private key to request opting in. This message will contain the Ethereum address that the proposer intends to use as the signer for individual preconfirmation requests. The ownership of this new ECDSA key-pair is then proven on-chain through a transaction sent by the proposer.

Bolt places additional slashing risk on proposers, but ways to reduce this risk or increase rewards can be explored. Acceptance into the Lido alliance would be a direct endorsement for Chainbound and Bolt, leading to collaboration and feedback on Boltâs design choices. Lido node operators are encouraged to participate in Validator Cohort 1 and provide ongoing assistance with validator adoption.

The Bolt protocol aims to support and grow Ethereum, with proposer agency and trustless proposer commitments being core towards making Ethereum more censorship-resistant and usable.

1. The Arbitrum Foundation is requesting 400 ETH for 3 years to reimburse honest parties' gas costs, with an additional buffer of 92 ETH in case of higher gas prices or multiple challenges per year.

2. To implement this, the following steps are proposed:
   - AIP publication and temperature checks on Snapshot for bond sentiment and operational cost sentiment.
   - If there is strong consensus, the AIP will be published as an on-chain AIP for a vote. If not, the proposal will be iterated on and re-submitted until there is consensus.
   - Assuming a successful vote, funds will be transferred to a multi-sig wallet controlled by the Arbitrum Foundation.
   - The Arbitrum Foundation will deposit the funds in a validator that will secure Arbitrum One if the AIP to upgrade the DAO-governed chains to use BoLD is passed.

3. The Arbitrum Foundation will not be entitled to the service fee but will be reimbursed for L1 gas costs. All payments and reimbursements for non-Arbitrum Foundation actors will be manually processed by the Arbitrum Foundation, adhering to their compliance process.

4. If the BoLD proposal is not approved by the ArbitrumDAO, the funds will be returned. After 3 years, any unspent funds will be returned to the ArbitrumDAO and a subsequent proposal will be posted to cover future operational costs of Arbitrum.

5. The ArbitrumDAO has the authority to return the funds to the treasury by revoking the Arbitrum Foundation's proposer at any time. This is implemented and enforced via the BoLD smart contracts.

Neemo is a DeFi project developed by experienced team members with expertise in areas such as lending, stable DEX, and yield optimization. The team includes Co-founder and CEO Seiya Chida who brings operational experience from Starlay Finance, Kagla Finance, and Muuu Finance on the Astar Network, as well as venture capital experience. Sagar Chaurasia, Co-founder and CTO, has extensive experience in the LST/LRT ecosystem and is known for his significant contributions to liquid staking protocols. Priyansh Saxena, Co-founder and CMO, brings marketing and content management skills from his work on Claystack, a liquid staking protocol on Ethereum.

The team structure includes six additional members across development, business development, audit, and design divisions. Neemo prioritizes security with three layers of measures including an audit company, peer audit, and onchain security using SphereX to prevent malicious activities.

The roadmap for Neemo includes launching nsASTR on Astar EVM mainnet in August, native staking and unstaking on other L2s in September, and near future development such as leveraged staking, distribution of dApp staking votes to other DeFi ecosystems, and a Token Generation Event (TGE) for their native token. The team is committed to building a better ecosystem and appreciates support from the community.

References are provided for more information about Neemo including their landing page, Twitter, Discord, and Medium.

The Lido DAO aims to simplify and decentralize Ethereum staking through a proposed permissionless staking module called Community Staking Module (CSM). This module, developed by a team within Lido DAO, aims to increase independent node operators' interaction with the protocol. Key features of CSM include smoothened rewards, competitive bond, user-friendly UX, low gas fees, and market-leading rewards. The proposed allocation for CSM is up to 10%, with a gradual increase to ensure security and reliability. Implementation of CSM is expected before the end of 2024, and partnerships with DeFi ecosystem projects are sought to facilitate its development. The goal is to attract at least 300 independent Node Operators within the first three months after launch. Feedback from the community and Ethereum ecosystem developers is encouraged for the proposed module.
Proposal to add a UST Tripool Metapool on Curve Finance platform for stablecoin liquidity and yield farming opportunities.

This supplementary note proposes two metrics, "rewarded capital" (RC) and "rewarded capital multiplier" (RCM), for evaluating staking projects. The RC represents the total amount of capital required to achieve a certain return, while RCM indicates the potential return relative to the initial investment.

The note provides examples for several staking projects, including Rocket Pool LEB8, Stader, Swell, and CSM (four versions). Each project's bond size in ETH, additional bond, APR ratio (K), maximum fee, RC, and RCM are compared.

At the time of writing, Rocket Pool offers LEB8 minipools with an RCM of 1.22, Stader provides permissionless staking with a 1.82 multiplier, and Swell does not have permissionless staking live yet but plans to launch with a 1.1 multiplier.

Looking into the future, it is assumed that Rocket Pool will launch LEB4 minipools (1.39) or even LEB4 without RPL requirement (1.98). Stader's rewards may decrease, resulting in a lower RCM, while introducing a 2 ETH bond for CSM could increase its RCM to 2.1. The complete calculations can be found in the provided link.
Make the AVAX-BNB yield farming option accessible.
Growing community anticipates increased participation in the government, with a potential bull run and incentivized content creation including tutorials, posts, events, and workshops.

The text discusses a DAO Governance Report on Ethereum ecosystem's DeFi DAOs, aiming to understand their governance structures. Key concepts like broad participation, resistance to capture, openness, and alignment of incentives were analyzed in 8 prominent DAOs.

Two notable initiatives highlighted from the report are Dxdao's Public Working Group Sessions for promoting transparency and free information sharing, and Aave's Governance Delay that allows a 7-day execution delay for approved proposals. The report suggests considering implementing similar openness policies in Maker governance and modifying the current 48-hour pause delay to provide more actionable time during contingencies.

Other potential practices identified include Quadratic Voting, Non-Transferable Voting Power, Voting Power Proportional to Vote-Escrowed Time Lock, Vesting Token Compensation for Contributors, Liquid Voting, Treasury Diversification, and others. The report was supported by the MakerDAO GovAlpha Core Unit throughout its preparation.

Discussion category for resources on MakerDAO ecosystem, sharing informative articles from reputable sources like The Maker Blog and The Maker Community Blog. Avoid low-quality posts; ask questions via DM to @seth if needed.

The text proposes adjustments to the liquidation threshold and collateral factor for wstETH and weETH in Venus's Staked ETH pool. The assets, wstETH and weETH, have shown strong peg stability and low volatility compared to WETH, allowing for increased borrowing power. The proposal suggests increasing the current collateral factors from 90% to 93% and adjusting the liquidation thresholds from 93% to 95%. This change aims to optimize the protocol by encouraging more deposits and looping.

In March, the Risk-Core-Unit focused on several key tasks including a proposal for Maker staking and tokenomics revision (stkMKR), analysis of wstETH-B, wstETH-C, and aETH feasibility, and adjusting parameters for various collaterals. Proposals were made for offboarding TUSD-A and adjusting CurveLP-stETH-ETH parameters. The team also worked on improving the Maker Risk Dashboard and Makerburn, and engaged with the community on various topics on the Maker Forum. Pending work includes L2 parameters discussions with other CUs, PAXG risk assessment revision if a signal passes, attending ETH Amsterdam in April, investigating wrapped YFI style strategies, launching Institutional Vaults, and developing monitoring tools for them. The team will continue to update the community monthly on these and other developments.

Chaos Labs suggests modifications to the WETH parameters in the Liquid Staked ETH pool, aiming to boost growth and optimize leverage yield strategies. The proposed changes include:

- Lowering the Collateral Factor for WETH to 0%, preventing self-looping and reducing borrowing rates without affecting other assets.
- Increasing the Kink for WETH to 90% for greater capital efficiency in the pool.
- Raising the Multiplier due to market overutilization, ensuring profitable leveraged yield strategies given ETH's staking yield of approximately 3.2%.
- Increasing the Reserve Factor to discourage self-looping while maintaining appeal for supplying WETH.

These recommendations are based on historical observations and current market conditions, with potential adjustments to the Multiplier if borrowing against other collateral decreases following the change.

To develop this product, resources are needed to retain historic data, and a growth pitch could emphasize the network's unique capabilities in providing comprehensive market insights.

Aragon Govern refers to the management system for Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs) within the Aragon ecosystem. It includes the Aragon Client for DAO creation, Aragon Voice for communication within and outside ERC20 communities, and Aragon Court for dispute resolution. The post provides an update on pZEIP-2, a feature under development for the 0x Community. The current version of the specification has been slightly modified, addressing token-to-token swaps but not handling ETH-to-token swaps correctly. To address this issue, custom routing has been implemented to handle native ETH on other chains.

The feature forwards individual calls in the received calldata array to the 0x Exchange Proxy (EP), maintaining the original call context. Custom routing is required only when necessary, and the EP executes a call to publicly exposed internal methods with proper parameter decoding and validation.

Some EP methods are not currently supported but could be with minimal complexity increase. The community is asked to suggest which features should be prioritized. After DenCun activation in March 2024, transient storage can be used for reentrancy lock modifiers, reducing gas costs.

The goal is now to finalize the implementation through an extensive peer review phase.

Title: Ethereum v2 Reserve Factor Adjustment Proposal

Summary: This proposal suggests incrementally increasing the Aave v2 Ethereum Reserve Factor (RF) to encourage users to migrate to Aave v3, with a 5% RF increase every 14 days across all assets. The proposed maximum RF is 99.99%. The RF adjustment does not directly affect users' health factor and has been implemented on Polygon v2 for some time.

Specification: The table below shows the current and recommended RF for each asset in Aave v2. The proposed RF increase will be submitted as an AIP every 14 days, subject to market conditions.

| Asset | Current RF| Recommended RF |
| ---  | ---    |---     |
| Various assets (e.g., 1INCH, AMPL, BUSD, etc.) | Varies | 99.99% |

The authors of this proposal do not receive payment for it and are both delegates within the Aave community. The next steps include gathering feedback from the community, escalating the proposal to Snapshot stage if consensus is reached, and submitting subsequent AIPs every 14 days thereafter. The proposal follows CC0 copyright terms.

PancakeSwap has introduced a new Syrup Pool with Nabox, a cross-chain wallet for Web 3.0. Users can stake CAKE tokens to earn NABOX tokens. The pool will distribute 366,050,000 NABOX tokens over 10 days starting approximately on December 3rd, 2021. The first 48 hours allow staking up to 100 CAKE, after which unlimited CAKE staking is allowed. The farm will offer 1x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours, then 0.5x rewards. Nabox allows users to manage assets across various chains and provides liquidity or stake NABOX tokens for rewards. Learn more about the project through its official channels: website, Telegram, Twitter, Discord, and Medium. Always verify the token address before buying tokens to avoid scams.

The metapool would attract more liquidity to Curve, increase trading fees, and stabilize ESD's price around $1. The Uniswap Arbitrum Delegate Program (UADP) successfully applied for and received the largest amount of ARB, 1,000,000, in the Arbitrum Long Term Incentive Program Pilot (LTIPP). They will collaborate with Gauntlet and Merkl to distribute these incentives. The UADP has lowered their initial request from 2.5M to 1M ARB to increase chances of admission.

The funds will be used for incentivizing liquidity providers on Uniswap, distributing the funds, funding Gauntlet's Applied Research team, and maintaining Uniswap DAO's voting participation in Arbitrum DAO. The UADP has a history with Arbitrum, being the dominant DEX by TVL and volume on the L2. They have also made significant contributions to the Arbitrum ecosystem over the past year.

Now, the UADP is conducting a temperature check to see if Uniswap delegates would like to reciprocate with funds, potentially signifying continued support and allowing for further collaboration and grants in the future. The options for funding are $250k, $500k, $750k, or not funding at all.

This subproposal, authored by Amy Jung, announces her offboarding from Operational Support effective May 31, 2021. This subproposal is a formality to confirm this decision and remove Amy's authority as an Operational Support Facilitator. There is no assigned Core Unit ID for Operational Support in this proposal.

The text discusses a proposed plan for transferring control of Sushi, initially joking about involving Larry Coin and Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF). The actual plan involves cancelling the old migration tied to Nomi's key, replacing it with an identical one tied to the current account, and allowing users to vote on a new multisig group to take control. If the majority votes against this migration within 12 hours, the plan will be cancelled. The final step is to transfer keys to the chosen multisig group, returning control of Sushi to the community. A vote will be held on the entire plan, and if the majority votes against, the plan will be abandoned and a new one will be developed.

The text introduces a new initiative called Valhalla, built on the BEP-429 standard, designed to enhance the Binance Smart Chain (BSC) ecosystem. This project aims to reward Venus Protocol users, suppliers of Venus, and holders of XVS and VAI tokens. The goal is to foster a more robust, inclusive, and growing BSC ecosystem through community discussion on the official Venus platform regarding the implementation of Valhalla and BEP-429 standard. This collaborative effort aims to solidify the foundation of the Venus Protocol as a leader in decentralized finance.

The community proposals are excessive, lasting for extended periods and offering referral codes. These actions disrupt the intended purpose of the system, causing unnecessary backlogs and nonsensical voting. Propose a vote to eliminate promotional activities and self-promotion.

The text discusses a proposal for a financial reporting system for Balancer DAO, aiming to provide insights into the organization's financial status. Karpatkey, serving as the treasury manager, proposes building and maintaining this system to facilitate integration with GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles) and enable better understanding of the DAO's finances.

The system will categorize transactions, provide balance statements, fund flow analysis, expenses breakdown, income breakdown, cash flow forecasting, and be accessible through an interactive website or PDF reports. The budget for this project includes a one-time grant of $20k USD in BAL and a quarterly fee of $6k USD also payable in BAL.

The community is encouraged to review the proposal and provide feedback. Future steps include conducting a temporary check, requesting access to bookkeeping records, collaborating with the Balancer Product team, generating financial reports, building and testing the UI, and presenting it to the community for final feedback before commencement of maintenance. Termination can be initiated by either party through the governance mechanism, with certain conditions regarding exit fees.

Uniswap proposes a $25M grant for Flipside Community-Enabled Analytics, utilizing a self-funded strategy. The goal is to generate analytics for user education and growth, distribute UNI through bounties, and leverage Uniswap's yield mechanisms.

Title: Proposal for Balancer Deployment on Linea Network

   Summary: Cameron from Linea proposes deploying Balancer on their network due to its growth and strategic partnerships. The proposal includes three main motivations: participation in the Surge liquidity campaign, supporting key partners, and positioning Balancer as core infrastructure for future product developments. The Surge program aims to distribute points for active liquidity, boosting the ecosystem and network volume. Linea's partnership with key protocols creates a demand for Balancer pools, offering a unique opportunity to establish significant liquidity. Collaboration opportunities with Consensys products in the short and long term are also highlighted. The proposal is open for discussion, and if approved, a timeline will be coordinated with Balancer contributors for deployment.

Balancer Labs is transferring governance control to the community, with three key elements: moving snapshot admin to a community representative, ceding control of the snapshot ENS, and determining soft consensus. The volunteer for the snapshot admin role is suggested to be one of the five full-time Ballers. A governance multisig will manage the ENS, and a "gov council" of the five Ballers will decide if a proposal should go to snapshot, with a majority vote required. A forum poll will also be included in each proposal as an additional signaling device. The proposal needs community discussion for at least three days before being posted on Twitter and Discord, and then taken to snapshot for a final decision.

3.26% + 3.0% = **6.26%**. The analysis shows that RWF projects an annual loss rate between 0.84% and 0.90%, depending on the asset mix. The Servicing Agreement states that HVB will be the exclusive servicer for the Participated Loans, with responsibilities including credit judgment, enforcement of obligations, and operating, managing, preserving, protecting, and disposing of Collateral. HVB will remit all cash, notes, securities, or other property received under or in respect of the Participated Interest to the Trust. The proposal aims to:

1. Increase rewards for farmers by adjusting the voting system and introducing bribes.
2. Increase the utility of staked CAKE through a new voting mechanism and bribe UI.
3. Increase protocol revenue by reducing CAKE emissions and increasing them temporarily.
4. Reduce CAKE emissions gradually over time.
5. Move towards "ultrasound money" by replacing emissions with income from other protocols and trading fees.

Expected outcomes include:
- Emissions reduction by 55% over 7 months.
- Staked CAKE holders' rewards switching from emissions to bribes + trading fees, avoiding a sudden cut in rewards.
- Steady increase in overall rewards allocated to farming.
- Increased liquidity in farms due to the option for 3rd party protocols to buy voting power with bribes.
- Reason for 3rd party protocols to buy and hold staked CAKE for voting purposes.
- Increased value of staked CAKE voting power.

Collateral Onboarding Call #25 took place on January 27, 2021, discussing potential assets for MakerDAO. The focus was on Lido, a protocol built on Ethereum 2.0's beacon chain that allows users to earn staking rewards without locking Ether or maintaining infrastructure. Users can deposit ETH and receive stETH, which represents their staked ETH balance along with rewards or penalties. Unlike beacon chain ETH, stETH can be freely transferred and traded. The aim is to onboard stETH to MakerDAO for users to borrow DAI against it, similar to ETH 1.0.

This week, there were no token requests for the whitelist used in Balancer's BAL governance token distribution. Proposed modifications to the whitelist include placing all new tokens at a $1M cap. Community members can suggest tokens for inclusion via the #token-requests channel on Discord. Whitelisted tokens will not automatically appear on the Balancer exchange UI, but can be traded using contract addresses. No new price pegs or omissions were introduced this week. The whitelist changes will take effect at 00:00 UTC on June 21.

0xMaki has been a crucial contributor to Sushi since its inception. A proposal suggests his full-time employment starting September 14, 2020. The rewards for his work will vest over three years to align with the project's success and token. The community will decide the scale of compensation beyond voting.

The proposed compensation does not include an upfront grant. It is a three-year vesting schedule using the Sablier Protocol for unlocking. If 0xMaki stops working full-time, the arrangement can be terminated by the community vote. The base compensation includes $10,000 per month for salary and expenses.

The final compensation will be determined by taking a weighted average value after voting is done. The proposal allows for potential future bonuses based on performance metrics like TVL/Volume/Revenue at the community's discretion.

Monthly CAKE emissions from Farms remain unchanged, while those for Syrup Pools increase. To combat inflation, it's proposed to decrease CAKE emission for Syrup Pools without significantly affecting Farm returns, crucial for platform liquidity and appeal.

Under the LIDO-1 budget, authorized signatories for PML and ATC will transfer DAI from the Lido treasury to their wallets. They may exchange this DAI for other stablecoins like USDT, USDP, GUSD, or LUSD to maintain operational continuity. This action is separate from ongoing discussions about the treasury proposals. Both PML and ATC have suggested allocations within these stablecoins. One proposed allocation is 60% USDT and 40% USDP. The operators are open to discussion during the Easy Track period. No DAI will be retained due to Aragon's overallocation to it. If exchange rates become unfavorable or transactional slippage exceeds 1%, operators will hold onto DAI. Funding for the next month and a half will be supplied as per LIDO-1, with any excess returned to the Aragon treasury at the end of April. Withdrawal requests up to 6.9m DAI will be processed, completing the total allowable amount under LIDO-1, minus the already spent amount. Links to the motions for easy access are provided on the ET UI.

The text describes a proposal for $5,000 funding to support a dedicated reporter covering Aragon DAO updates and events for one year. The reporter will publish 50 articles on the DAO Times website, attracting new members and keeping current ones informed. This initiative aims to promote transparency, increase community engagement, and foster a better-informed and more active DAO community. The funding will ensure editorial independence and won't compromise the content's objectivity. The project commences immediately upon approval and runs for one year. The reporter will develop an editorial calendar, research, write, review, edit, publish, and promote articles on DAO Times' Twitter profile while encouraging community suggestions. This proposal aligns with the mission of Aragon DAO and benefits both parties by providing publicity and an independent perspective on the DAO.
24/7 availability for tasks with potential profit, regardless of nature or payment status.

The text discusses a proposal concerning a potential founder's bonus for Chef Nomi, the original founder of Sushi Swap. Despite his past actions involving the misuse of tokens and subsequent return of funds to the community, he is recognized for his significant contribution to the project's success.

The text emphasizes the community's choice to either punish or forgive Chef Nomi, suggesting that forgiveness could lead to positive outcomes. It also mentions that he may still be liable for taxes on the profits from selling SUSHI tokens. The final decision regarding any potential bonus is left to the community in this proposal.

The text describes a Cake NFT token system where a fixed amount of tokens are earned by staking Cake. These tokens can be used to purchase or bid for new Pancakeswap NFTs and then recycled back to stakers. The tokens are tradeable, with their price determined by the community. A 5% tax is applied on token sales/purchases to encourage keeping/farming the tokens. This system could benefit Cake in several ways:
1. Lower competition in regular pools/farms, potentially increasing APY.
2. Offering an additional income source that might surpass current farms.
3. Increasing Cake's demand due to the new token system.
Proposal to add OBTC and SBTC metapools on Curve Finance for decentralized trading of these assets.

Synapse Protocol is set to deploy on the Kava EVM chain, with a $40K grant from Kava ecosystem upon successful deployment and listing on DefiLlama under Kava. The grant will be paid in KAVA tokens using a 30-day moving average for pricing. This move aims to strengthen Synapse's position as the most user-friendly bridge connecting EVM and Cosmos.

Additionally, Kava Network is introducing the Kava Rise Program, an incentive model distributing $750M in KAVA over 4 years to projects based on TVL (Total Value Locked).

Kava Network has combined Ethereum and Cosmos ecosystems into a single, developer-friendly Layer-1 network. It uses a unique co-chain architecture for seamless interoperability between the two environments, with over 60 EVM DeFi protocols like Curve & SushiSwap now onboarded.

Alex expresses gratitude towards the Executive Sub DAO for their exceptional work over the past few weeks on Aragon proposals. He suggests using a portion of the scout program's allocated funds (approximately $6000) to create a Coordinape circle for the ESD, as compensation for their significant efforts. This is intended as an initial step, with further changes expected in the long term. The proposal aims for implementation within a week.

The text discusses a vote to bring four new developers onto the SushiSwap team, including BoringCrypto (architect), Clearwood, I'm Software, and Joseph Delong (CTO). Each candidate has been selected for their contributions to the project. BoringCrypto is known in the community and crucial for development, Clearwood has been involved in QA and various tasks, I'm Software has contributed significantly to analytics.fi, and Joseph brings management and technical knowledge. The new hires will receive compensation ranging from 0 USDC to 120k USDC, with the rest paid in Sushi tokens. They will also receive a signing bonus of 20k Sushi and performance bonuses decided by the community. All candidates are self-starters and top talent, and their contracts will be revisited at the end of one year. Current core devs will also follow the new hiring guidelines after their contract duration ends.

The proposal aims to register DED as an XC-20 token on the Astar Network. This registration is intended to facilitate the use of DED within the Astar Network ecosystem and in protocols built upon it. DED is proposed as a meme coin within the Polkadot Ecosystem, with the intention of fostering growth by allowing users to interact with the network and perform cross-chain transfers. To achieve this, it's suggested that meme coins like DED be available on multiple parachains such as Astar Network, given its large community. The next steps are to register the token from the Polkadot Asset Hub and list it on the Astar Portal. More information can be found on their website (dotisded.io) and Telegram channel (@dedbird).

The text discusses a media project founded by the author, who is considering building their app on the Starknet ecosystem due to its potential for scalability and infrastructure support. The app aims to focus on micropayments and is fee-sensitive. They are exploring two routes: integrating with Volitions or spinning up their own L3 (Layer 3).

The author has questions about these options:
1. If using Volitions, will contracts lose synchronous composability if they use different DA solutions?
2. If they spin up their own L3, can they abstract it away from users by employing a bridge for synchronous composability or account abstraction at the wallet level using relayers? They aim to avoid manual bridging due to concerns about user experience.
3. The author seeks estimates of transaction fee differences between using an L3 versus Volitions on Starknet directly, and if relayers from L2 to L3 are used for each transaction, whether any cost advantages would be lost.

The author is seeking insights into these questions from the community.

The proposal aims to update the multisig signers for the Emergency subDAO Multisig across all networks, reflecting current strategic direction and team composition. Removed signers include Markus, Solarcurve, Fernando, and Zekraken, while Hypernative, Franz, Daniel, and Xeonus are added. The updated list of signers is provided along with the safe addresses to be updated on various networks. All new signers need to confirm their agreement in the relevant thread. The procedure involves the Emergency Multi-sig interacting with the GnosisSafeProxy contract on each corresponding chain and updating the owner addresses.
Prediction of CRV reaching its all-time high cannot be definitively determined from the provided text.

4/5 proposals suggest hiring 0xMaki at allegedly high salaries for a community-driven project. Some argue against this, stating everyone works voluntarily to grow mutual investments. If someone must be hired, they believe ChefNomi is the best choice, despite one past mistake, due to his demonstrated lack of greed and trustworthiness.

Voting 'yes' suggests support for investigating potential uses of the DAO community fund, with no immediate commitments to specific projects. Future proposals will be presented in CIPs (Community Improvement Proposals).

Title: Enabling PSP/OP Pool on Optimism with BAL Emission Cap

   Summary: A proposal has been made to enable the PSP/OP 80/20 pool on Optimism, capped at a 2% BAL emission. This pool serves as the main liquidity for PSP on Optimism and the BAL gauge is crucial for further boosting its liquidity.

   Description: Paraswap is a DeFi aggregator that combines the liquidity of decentralized exchanges and lending protocols into one secure interface and APIs. The $PSP token governs Paraswap DAO.

   References: Visit paraswap.io for more information, including documentation and GitHub page.

The candidate is running for a Council Member position on Optimism's Security Council. They are an individual residing nomadically across Africa, Oceania, and Asia. They have previously served as a Council Member in Cohort A of Optimism's Security Council and have not served on any other council or board within the Collective. They are not affiliated with OP Labs or any other OP Chain.

The candidate has contributed to the Optimism ecosystem by being a member of the Security Council since its launch, serving as a Badgeholder, and voting in almost all rounds since Season 2. They have also been actively involved in growing the Ethereum ecosystem in Africa through Borderless Africa.

They do not have a technical background but have gone through rehearsals for evaluating and executing upgrades for the Collective. They have participated in signing all upgrades since the beginning of the OP Security Council and have communicated actively with council members during each signing process.

The candidate believes a good Security Council member should be ready to sign routine upgrades, highlight inconsistencies, and be available in times of crisis to protect the Superchain from attacks. They have disclosed no conflicts of interest and understand that they may be removed via the Representative Removal proposal type in the Operating Manual. They are also aware of the potential for a Foundation screen which may include KYC/AML, sanctions screening, and a requirement to sign a standard contract. They can commit approximately 5 active hours per month to fulfill the Member Responsibilities.

The text discusses a proposal by Hermes DeFi to deploy Uniswap V3 on the Harmony blockchain. They have received positive feedback and have revised their proposal, which is now posted on the Uniswap governance forum. If approved, Uniswap will receive various benefits such as a 10% allocation of HERMES tokens, 25% of platform trading fees in IRIS (decreasing annually for five years), 50% of fees for the IRIS/1UNI pair, 2% of IRIS supply, lending and borrowing support for 1UNI, and the ability to bond 1UNI for HERMES.

The text discusses concerns about the DZAR token, which is not backed by any assets and does not provide claims to Digital Rand (Pty) Ltd's assets. Its peg to ZAR (fiat currency) is maintained voluntarily by Digital Rand (Pty) Ltd., who can terminate it at any time. The token's creators have the ability to print unlimited amounts of DZAR, which could potentially drain liquidity pools and cause significant losses and negative publicity. The author suggests that encouraging DZAR liquidity on platforms like Balancer poses a significant risk for potential liquidity providers joining these pools.

The Council is authorized and encouraged to retain technical writing support focused on policy and law, as well as technical writers and advisors to aid in informed decision-making. Council members may resign at any point, and vacancies can be filled by the Core Oversight Board or through a snapshot vote. The council will hold elections every 6 months for re-election or replacement of members.

Council compensation includes Locked Council Badger (LCB) which is locked for one year to align interests with long-term value creation, and a monthly stipend paid in unlocked BADGER. Councilors may choose to waive compensation while remaining on the council.

The Chairbadger receives 5000 LCB annually, vested monthly and redeemable after one year of service. Expert or advisory support can be paid up to $6,000 per month with a majority council vote, between $6,001 and $15,000 per month with approval from the Treasury Board, and over $15,000 per month with BIP approval. The council is also granted 350 BADGER per month for Gitcoin bounties, analytics work, and research.

The total max council spend at $8.75 per BADGER is as shown in the provided budget image. Voters are asked to approve these governance improvements with options being Yes, No, or Almost - There are some things that need to be reworked before this is ready for prime-time.

Stader Labs, the developer of MaticX, a popular non-custodial Liquid Staking Token (LST) on the Matic Network, has proposed adding a Matic market to Compound V3. This move is motivated by the success of money markets in general and the top strategy used in LSTs, Leveraged staking loops. The creation of a Matic market would provide a risk-free correlated asset pair (MaticX-Matic) for aggressive LTV strategies, potentially increasing TVL and revenue for Compound and Stader. Assets proposed as collateral include Matic, MaticX, and stMatic. The community is invited to suggest additional collateral assets and parameters such as Collateral Factor, Reserve Factor, and Borrowing Limit. The proposal can be discussed on the Compound Forum and with @Knight_Mayr on Telegram. Relevant links for more information are provided.

The Sustainable Ecosystem Core Unit within MakerDAO focuses on incubating new units, identifying scaling challenges, and sponsoring ideas for growth and innovation. This unit can be found in the Powerhouse group. Core Units are essential building blocks for organizing work within the DAO, defining long-term areas of focus, and ensuring the protocol's security and success. For more information about Core Units, refer to MIP39: Core Unit Framework.

Title: Ape Hospitality Group: ApeCoin Summit Proposal

Description: This proposal aims to host a conference and party at the Wyndham Grand Clearwater Beach hotel for up to 300 ApeCoin ($APE) holders. The event will provide an opportunity for $APE holders and partner communities to interact, network, and learn about the DAO's activities. Ownership of ApeCoin will be verified at registration, with different tiers offering conference and party access or hotel rooms based on the number of ApeCoins held. The event will feature panel discussions, networking opportunities, pop-up stalls for MBA licensees, and parties.

Benefits: This conference aims to create a more welcoming environment for $APE holders, help grow the unique number of holders, and foster a sense of belongingness within the ApeCoin DAO community.

Implementation Steps: Once approved, the team will handle necessary arrangements with the hotel, coordinate panel discussions and schedules, reach out to existing MBA licensees, and execute the event setup. The project is expected to start upon approval and last for six months.

Costs: The total amount requested from the ApeCoin Ecosystem Fund is $300,000 USD to be paid in $APE. This includes booking costs, media and entertainment expenses, operational costs, and additional costs detailed in the implementation steps.

Reporting Expectations: The team will provide updates on bookings, marketing outcomes, stakeholder engagement, panelist confirmations, preliminary attendee numbers, final preparations, event feedback, and a financial recap at various stages of the project. The proposal will be considered "fully implemented" upon the completion of the event and evaluation of its success.
Proposal to prioritize development of lending & borrowing, and fixed term staking mechanisms on PancakeSwap for increased cake burning and liquidity attraction.

The text discusses a current payment process involving multiple steps through AN DAO Govern and ESD Govern, which is considered inefficient due to potential delays and errors. A proposed solution simplifies the process by sending funds directly from AN DAO Govern to the ESD Multisig, reducing the number of actions in Aragon Govern and thereby minimizing chances of delay or error. The new process still allows for community challenges and maintains ESD's ultimate say in finalizing transactions. The Finance Squad has already tested this new process once with ESD's consent and found it to be more efficient.
CurveFi proposes adding MUSD as a fifth meta-pool in CIP-21, aiming to improve liquidity and stability of the decentralized exchange.

The ARFC proposes focusing stablecoin collateral usage on USDT and USDC, setting LTV to zero for less-trafficked stablecoins and long-tail assets, and adjusting Reserve Factor percentages for different collateral types. This strategy shift aims to minimize risk, optimize revenue generation, and align with market demand trends. The proposal suggests phasing out certain stablecoins like FRAX, LUSD, EURS, agEUR, JEUR, MAI, KNC, STG, BAL, FXS, UNI, and WBTC.e from the platform, following community feedback and consensus, ARFC snapshot stage, and AIP stage if successful. The proposal is independent of the ACI.

The proposal structure is suggested to be updated, enabling proponents to bond funds into a contract for potential use if their proposal is accepted. If rejected, the funds are refunded. This higher-tier proposal allows community members to donate, with requirements such as DAO/Treasury or anonymous individuals contributing a certain amount. The proposal may have a time limit set by the proponent and could be funded using BEAM, BEAMX, and NPH. The proposal suggests updating the after burner function on the locked CAKE staking pool. Currently, when someone's CAKE lock expires and they fail to withdraw or re-lock within 7 days, their rewards start burning gradually over a few months until they reach zero. The update aims to introduce a bounty system where community members can claim a reward for moving expired CAKE from the locked pool to the flexi pool.

The bounty system works by allowing community members with at least 10,000 vCAKE to move the expired CAKE, claim a reward equal to 10% of the earned CAKE rewards, and send 10% of the earned CAKE rewards to the burn. The first person to claim the reward gets it.

The after burner will not start immediately after 7 days; instead, it will begin after the same time period as the coins were locked. For example, if coins were locked for 7 months, the after burner would start 7 months after the lock expires. This change aims to benefit forgetful stakers by returning their investment plus 80% of earned CAKE rewards and staking all their CAKE in the flexi pool for more CAKE rewards. The community member who moves the expired CAKE will pay a transaction fee, while the protocol benefits from 10% of the earned CAKE reward being burned.

The Gauge Proposal aims to whitelist a Threshold Network veBAL voting gauge for the WETH-T Pool with a 2% emissions cap. Threshold Network, formed in 2022 by the merger of NuCypher and Keep, offers privacy, access controls, encryption, and cross-chain asset bridges. The proposed gauge is intended to boost liquidity in the Balancer pool, helping Threshold establish itself as a significant participant in the Balancer ecosystem.

The Threshold DAO governs T tokens through Governor Bravo, snapshot votes, and forum proposals. The asset has displayed comparable volatility to similar market cap assets. The primary source of liquidity for T is Curve, with Balancer being the second largest source after Curve. The gauge proposal includes a 2% emissions cap and has been audited by ChainSecurity and Certik. There are no significant centralization vectors in the protocol.

In Aave Protocol, users deposit various cryptocurrencies to contribute to the liquidity pool, earning interest in return. Interest rates are influenced by market supply and demand: higher demand for a specific currency like DAI with low supply leads to increased interest rates, while low demand and high supply result in lower rates. Users can view their Annual Percentage Yield (APY) on the Aave Decentralized Application (DApp), which represents the yearly return including compounding interest. APY is subject to change based on market conditions but also provides a 30-day average for a broader perspective.

Introducing GhoShare, an iOS app designed to streamline expense management using blockchain technology. The app utilizes the GHO token, credit delegation, and cross-network transactions. It was initially developed for the LFGHO hackathon hosted by ETH Global and won first place in the Aave Payments and Chainlink tracks.

Key features include credit delegation & token swapping, user onboarding & financial operations, and upcoming workflow systems & automated triggers for enhanced expense management efficiency. The app will be available on the Apple App Store soon. GhoShare aims to serve both crypto-savvy users and newcomers, simplifying shared financial management while promoting GHO's utility within the DeFi space. For more information, reach out to Jeevan or Artemiy, or visit their LFGHO Submission and GitHub repository.
BetFury is a crypto gaming platform offering various games, staking, and faucet rewards. Users can earn cryptocurrencies by playing games or participating in promotions.

GreenTrust is a token aiming to address blockchain and crypto inefficiencies, combining DeFi and sustainability concepts. It rewards token holders while promoting environmental improvement. The project deserves increased visibility for its community focus. No specific website or social media links provided. A proposal exists to establish a GNT-BUSD farm.
CurveFi proposes SCIP-24, a plan to introduce RENFIL and WFIL pools.

The Arbitrum Foundation is seeking 4,234 ETH from the ArbitrumDAO for assertion and challenge bonds to run a BoLD validator, acting as the first active proposer for Arbitrum One. If approved, the funds will be used to secure Arbitrum One, with the possibility for other parties to become proposers after an upgrade of the dispute protocol. The request is part of a multi-step process that includes temperature checks, on-chain voting, and potential fund return if the proposal is not approved. The ArbitrumDAO retains the authority to return the funds at any time.

A reputation system is being developed for DAO contributors at Karma, which includes a Karma reputation dashboard that ranks Balancer's governance participants based on their activity in snapshot voting, on-chain voting, and forum discussions. To fully view one's reputation, governance participants are encouraged to link their forum handle/username to the wallet used for voting. This will consolidate all activity in one place and increase the user's karma reputation score. Interested users can link their forum handle to their wallet on the Karma dashboard via a provided guide video.

The post is a request from Rex Hygate, dated April 10, 2024, for the AAVE community to fund a DeFiSafety Quality Certificate for both AAVE V3 and AAVE V2, amounting to 15K annually. This certificate serves as a badge of quality for users who may not understand smart contract audits. The goal is to provide a clear and understandable badge of quality similar to ISO 27001 or SOC2 but for DeFi.

The certificate indicates quality, refers to a human-readable, auditable report with references, and provides assurance that the protocol follows best practices and has auditable transparency. The AAVE community can assist by placing the DeFiSafety quality certificate logo on their security page and by connecting with liquidity providers to drive acceptance of these certificates.

The post also includes links to detailed reports for both AAVE V3 and AAVE V2 on the DeFiSafety website. The author expresses availability for questions or comments.

This proposal aims to adjust nine risk parameters across five Aave V2 assets, aligning with a chosen Moderate risk level by the Aave community. The adjustments are part of Gauntlet's regular parameter recommendations, driven by an optimization function balancing insolvencies, liquidations, and borrow usage. The proposed changes seek to maintain overall risk tolerance while making specific asset trade-offs. For more details, refer to Gauntlet's Parameter Recommendation Methodology and Model Methodology.

The following table shows the current and recommended values for each parameter:

| Parameter | Current Value | Recommended Value |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| BAL Loan To Value     | 65%     | 62%     |
| BAL Liquidation Bonus    | 8.0%     | 7.0%     |
| DAI Liquidation Threshold     | 80%     | 85%     |
| XSUSHI Loan To Value     | 50%     | 47%     |
| XSUSHI Liquidation Bonus    | 8.5%     | 8.0%     |
| STETH Loan To Value     | 73%     | 76%     |
| STETH Liquidation Threshold    | 75%     | 77%     |
| YFI Loan To Value     | 50%     | 46%     |
| YFI Liquidation Threshold    | 65%     | 68%     |

The community is encouraged to use Gauntlet's Risk Dashboard for a better understanding of the updated parameter suggestions and general market risk in Aave V2. The Value at Risk represents the 95th percentile insolvency value, while Liquidations at Risk represents the 95th percentile liquidation volume.

This text appears to provide an update on various projects related to the Maker ecosystem, which is a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) focused on creating the Dai stablecoin. Here are some key points:

1. Sensitivity analyses for structuring covenants are being requested from Maker token holders regarding potential quantum deals (nine figures).

2. Green-light polls have been initiated for two Oasis Pro Markets projects in Egypt and India involving green power plants and bonds. These projects are undergoing review by the Risk, Warnings, and Fulfillment (RWF) team and the Legal Team Services (LTS).

3. Robinland has passed the green-light and is working with RWF to restructure and professionalize MIP-6 according to MIP67. The first draft of the updated MIP6 is currently under review.

4. Untangled withdrew its application after a commercial risk evaluation was completed in November 2021, and recommendations were provided by RWF, LTS, and the Compliance, Education, and Support (CES) team regarding vault proceedings.

5. The group continues to support counterparties with active off-chain vaults and those that have been greenlit, as well as being available for consultation for any other counterparty seeking to understand Maker's stance on real-world assets or the onboarding process.

6. The text also mentions various communication, transaction updates, assessments, analyses, frameworks, and incubatee updates related to the Maker ecosystem.

7. Budget statements are provided for December 2021 through March 2022.

8. References are given for further reading on topics such as RWAs (Real World Assets), MIP6 vs. TradFi, RWA Lending Principles, SocGen updates, collateral onboarding updates, analyses, frameworks, and incubatee updates.

In summary, gTrade utilizes a custom-built Chainlink Decentralized Oracle Network (DON) for real-time, aggregated prices for their leveraged trading products. The network is operated by 8 independent Chainlink node operators and one price feed from StorkOracle. The oracle architecture uses official Chainlink Price Feeds as anchors to ensure accuracy.

The gUSDC asset, which will be the primary source of liquidity for the Balancer pool once the bootstrapping phase is over, has been active since June 15th and currently sits at a $2M TVL. The pool generates consistent fees due to gUSDC depositors using Balancer as a means of exiting before the epoch system, looping through lending markets, and liquidations through lending markets.

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 contract to add the ArbitrumRootGauge to the pool. The pool is not intended to be the primary source of liquidity during the bootstrapping phase but will serve as such once it has passed.

Audits have been conducted for each upgrade, with the V8 and V9 releases having been audited. The current custom decentralized oracle network is the most centralized facet due to its operation by 8 independent Chainlink node operators and one price feed from StorkOracle.

The authors propose a new distribution plan where UNI will be distributed at half the rate for an additional two months, with adjustments in the pool distributions. The proposal outlines a four-week pilot starting on January 25, aiming to reimburse gas costs for swaps performed through the Balancer Exchange Proxy using up to 7,500 BAL per week. This initiative aims to alleviate gas cost and usability issues in Balancer v1 while encouraging users to try the new exchange UI.

Eligible transactions are those made directly to the Balancer Exchange Proxy from externally owned accounts, targeting traders who use the Balancer Exchange UI. Eligible swaps include transactions between WETH, WBTC, USDC, DAI, BAL, and possibly other tokens in the future. The gas reimbursement will be the lowest of either the total gas used by the transaction or 100,000 times the number of eligible swaps in the transaction, with the gas price for reimbursements being the lowest of either the transaction's gas price or the median price of all transactions within the enclosing block.

Reimbursements will be made in BAL, and the price oracle will be CoinGecko's API. Claims will be available via the same MerkleRedeem contract used in the liquidity mining program. The pilot is budgeted with 7,500 BAL per week, with data from the week of January 4 suggesting that approximately 1,500 BAL would suffice for reimbursements. This program will not affect ongoing Liquidity Mining or Ecosystem Fund Grants campaigns.

The team encourages community feedback on these updates and welcomes suggestions for additional useful information.

Visit their website, discord, Twitter, docs, or GitHub for more information. The COMP token can be found on Coingecko and Etherscan.

The Uniswap ecosystem is a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform built on Ethereum that allows for automated liquidity provision and trading of ERC-20 tokens. The smart contracts for Uniswap V3, the latest version of the protocol, were developed by Scopelift and have undergone rigorous testing and auditing by multiple teams, including Trail of Bits. The contracts are also subject to a 10-day Code4rena contest and a $1m bug bounty hosted by Immunefi for further security hardening.

There are two front ends for accessing the Uniswap V3 protocol: Avantgarde Finance's React app, which enables staking, delegation, and fee collection, and Agora's app at vote.uniswapfoundation.org, which integrates staking and delegation functionality.

The introduction of a protocol fee in future proposals could impact the liquidity of the Uniswap protocol, and a report by Gauntlet provides a framework for evaluating this impact. Delegators are encouraged to do their due diligence on delegates and consider the potential impact on the protocol's future.

The Uniswap Foundation is an organization dedicated to promoting education around and adoption of blockchain technologies and decentralized protocols. This summary does not constitute legal advice, and readers should consult their own advisers regarding any legal, business, tax, accounting, or other matters related to the proposal.

The proposal is for a gauge to enable trading of inankrETH/ankrETH on Ethereum, using the InceptionLRT platform. InceptionLRT is an isolated liquid restaking protocol for Liquid Staking Tokens (LSTs), issuing Isolated Liquid Restaking Tokons (iLRTs) for each restaked LST. These iLRTs can be traded and used in DeFi protocols while maintaining segregation from the underlying LSTs. The goal is to increase liquidity of inankrETH, support its utility, and integrate it into various DeFi protocols.

Governance is handled by ING holders who influence the protocol's direction and policies. Incentives are allocated through gauge weight voting, impacting the protocol's dynamics. Rewards are earned by providing ING to liquidity pools and locking LP tokens. The system undergoes security audits for user fund safety. It aims to bolster the EigenLayer framework by addressing liquidity locking issues in the DeFi landscape. Further details can be found on their website, documentation, GitHub page, Twitter, and Discord communities provided.

The text discusses the author's dissatisfaction with the distribution of airdrops in the Starknet network. They found the requirement to have 0.005 ETH in the wallet for the first airdrop round unreasonable, as it exposed their NFT assets to potential hacking risks. The author suggests alternative metrics such as interacting with at least 5 Starknet dapps or issuing NFTs to identify real users.

They also criticize the unequal distribution of subsequent airdrops, where those who qualified for the first airdrop received large amounts of Stark (Strk), making it difficult for others to compete for the second airdrop. The author argues that if the first airdrop allocation had been remixed and distributed to the entire Starknet community, more users would have continued using the network. They express their anger and disappointment, hoping for a fairer distribution in future airdrops to regain some of the lost community.

The proposal aims to transfer voting rights for Working Group Steward positions in the ApeCoinDAO community from the Ape Assembly to a DAO-wide voting system. This change is proposed due to concerns about the legitimacy of elections with few active voters and the need for Stewards with extensive community outreach experience. The shift will occur during the upcoming Metaverse and Marketing and Communications Working Group elections on Nov 1, 2023.

The proposal benefits the ApeCoin ecosystem by ensuring that Working Groups fulfill their mandates, providing critical functions, and maintaining a voice for the broader ApeCoin DAO community through voting rights. The proposal aligns with the DAO's values of Collective Responsibility and Boldness by addressing representation issues in Working Group Steward elections and striving for progress over perfection.

The implementation of this proposal is managed by the Ape Foundation, with the possibility of alterations to optimize security, usability, and protection of APE holders. Any significant deviations from the original proposal will be disclosed to the APE holder community.

The text introduces the First Wave Integrator Program, an initiative by Maker Endgame for projects in the crypto ecosystem to integrate their upcoming stablecoin, offering native token rewards, savings rate, and enhanced utility. Projects can earn marketing fees from Improved Accessibility Rewards. Eligible segments include L1's, L2's, Wallets, Exchanges, dApps, and Consumer applications. The program considers live and active products, community reach, segment focus, and strategic alignment with Maker Endgame's DeFi core adoption strategy for selection. Interested project teams can apply via a Google form. The goal is to scale the transformative power of DeFi globally using this program and the Maker platform.

In a recent governance vote, liquidations have been activated for stablecoin vaults USDC-A, USDP-A, and GUSD-A to address false revenue accrual accounting issues. This is due to interest accrual on positions below the 100% collateral ratio in these vaults. The bad debt will be written off upon liquidation, resulting in a slight loss during collateral auctions. Accounts with less than 100% CR are present in USDC-A and USDP-A, with respective bad debts of approximately 1.24 million DAI and 55.1k DAI. GUSD-A has no such positions.

Liquidations will be triggered for positions below a Liquidation Ratio (LR) of 101%. Once activated, liquidations will include bad debt positions and others currently underwater. Proposed liquidation parameters have been set for each asset. The worst-case scenario could result in a 3.58 million DAI bad debt, but losses are expected to be significantly lower due to the settlement of auctions before the maximum discount is reached. This event will also involve writing off 1.30 million DAI falsely accrued revenue.

The proposal aims to secure a $1M annual grant for a community analytics program within the Sushi ecosystem. Expected outcomes include upgrading website analytics, covering multiple chains, and providing insights on key product lines. It anticipates acquiring 460 active, engaged community members and retaining 27,000 SUSHI in the ecosystem. The plan includes delivering half of the grant as bounties to community members and using the other half for operational costs. An oversight committee will ensure proper use of funds, with representatives from Sushi, Arca, and Flipside Crypto. The committee will evaluate the program's continuation annually.

The proposal aims to establish a gauge for instETH/wstETH on Ethereum, provided by InceptionLRT. InceptionLRT is an isolated Liquid Restaking protocol designed to enhance the EigenLayer framework, focusing on stETH and rETH. Its core feature involves issuing Isolated Liquid Restaking Tokens (iLRTs) for each restaked LST. These iLRTs can be traded freely and used in DeFi protocols while maintaining segregation from underlying LSTs. The motivation is to increase instETH liquidity, support its utility, and integrate it into various DeFi protocols.

Governance is handled by ING holders who influence the protocol's direction and policies. Incentives are allocated through gauge weight voting, directing rewards towards preferred liquidity. Participation involves providing ING to liquidity pools and locking LP tokens to earn veING, granting access to various protocol benefits.

InceptionLRT undergoes security audits for user fund safety. No major volatility has been observed in its market history. Further information about Inception's decentralization can be found in the EigenLayer - Inception iLRTs Docs.

1UP is a community engagement tool that allows users to give shoutouts and tokens simultaneously. The system consists of a bot, front-end, and DAO integration. RaidGuild has been using it internally for six months, but they aim to make it available to all DAOs, including Aragon. They are seeking a grant to create an Aragon 1UP integration. The goal is to make sending tokens as easy as saying "1UP!". The MVP will be built on xDAI to reduce gas fees. The team behind the project includes experienced Web3 developers and they expect the project to take 3-4 weeks. They are requesting 4,135 DAI and 0.751 ETH for their efforts and have also applied to the CV Grants DAO for further support.

Title: Cross-Community Spaces and Reward Vault for Education and Engagement in Apecoin Ecosystem

   The proposal aims to establish MOCA MONDAY Spaces to educate various communities about the ApecoinDAO, its processes, and upcoming AIPs. This initiative will foster a Cross-Community focused environment where different communities can learn from each other, particularly about the ApecoinDAO, participation, voting, and current AIPs.

   Key highlights include weekly discussions on all AIPs up for voting, live sessions with AIP authors and partners, promoting cross-community news, increasing ApecoinDAO, Ape Assembly, and Mocaverse DAO participation, and boosting knowledge about BAYC, Apecoin, Yugalabs, and their ecosystem.

   The budget will be allocated for community engagement, production enhancement, software, talent costs, and production consultation. The total requested fund is 76,830 USDC for a 12-month operation, including a 12-month reward vault.

   The AIP implementation is managed by the Ape Foundation, with potential alterations to optimize security, usability, and protect APE holders. Any significant deviations from the initial proposal will be disclosed to the APE holder community.

It seeks to be a faithful guide (Sancho) throughout the journey, teaching and learning from you and your offerings. As a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO), they love exploring decentralization and privacy fields but want to get to know you! They believe that growth can only be achieved by understanding their community better. To do this, they find nothing better than good metrics, pie charts, and bar graphs. The text proposes integrating Sushiswap into Infinity Wallet, enabling direct trading and liquidity provision within the wallet. This integration would leverage Infinity Wallet's advanced technology for interacting with the Uniswap protocol. The author believes this partnership would be beneficial due to Infinity Wallet's openness to new integrations based on community interest. The proposal suggests that the Sushi team should reach out to Infinity Wallet, offering a 300k Sushi token integration and a vesting schedule of 50% upfront with further 25% distributed over two years.

The proposal aims to consolidate Badger emissions onto the ibBTC/sBTC Sett, reallocating existing rewards and adjusting ibBTC Sett emissions. Additionally, it increases bveCVX Sett rewards for Q4 by adding a 5% targeted Badger APR and 10,000 weekly cvxCRV emissions. To offset migration costs, an airdrop of up to 25k Badger is planned for users who mint ibBTC and deposit it into the app or for current users with non-native balance greater than $0 who do the same. The text discusses concerns about the stability of USDC, a digital currency, and suggests transitioning to BUSD as an alternative due to its similarities with USDC in terms of risk profile. The author criticizes the lack of action taken since the issue was first raised last year. They also express concern about the potential default of USDC, which could pose an existential risk to DAI, a digital currency that is heavily backed by USDC. The author suggests onboarding BUSD as collateral to diversify and reduce the risk of a single collateral default. They also express disappointment in the handling of the situation, stating that DAI's reputation has been tarnished due to these events.
